00141 typedef struct cmdCacheInode_thr_info__
00142 {
00143 
00144   int is_thread_init;
00145 
00146   /* export context : on for each thread,
00147    * on order to make it possible for them
00148    * to access different filesets.
00149    */
00150   fsal_export_context_t exp_context;
00151 
00153   fsal_op_context_t context ;
00154   
00156   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00157   
00158   int is_client_init;
00159 
00161   cache_entry_t * pentry  ;
00162 
00164   char current_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN]; /* current path */
00165 
00166   
00168   cache_inode_client_t client ;
00169   cache_content_client_t dc_client ;
00170 
00171 } cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t;
00172 
00173 
00174 /* pthread key to manage thread specific configuration */
00175 
00176 static pthread_key_t  thread_key ;
00177 static pthread_once_t once_key = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT ;
00178 
00179 
00180 /* init pthtread_key for current thread */
00181 
00182 static void init_keys( void )
00183 {
00184   if( pthread_key_create( &thread_key, NULL ) == -1 )
00185     printf( "Error %d creating pthread key for thread %p : %s\n",
00186         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00187   
00188   return ;
00189 } /* init_keys */
00190 
00191 
00196 static cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t  * GetCacheInodeContext()
00197 {
00198   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * p_current_thread_vars ;
00199   
00200   /* first, we init the keys if this is the first time */
00201   if( pthread_once( &once_key, init_keys ) != 0 ){
00202     printf( "Error %d calling pthread_once for thread %p : %s\n",
00203         errno,(caddr_t)pthread_self(),strerror(errno) ) ;
00204     return NULL;
00205   }
00206   
00207   p_current_thread_vars = (cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t *)pthread_getspecific( thread_key );
00208   
00209   /* we allocate the thread context if this is the first time */
00210   if (p_current_thread_vars==NULL){
00211       
00212     /* allocates thread structure */
00213     p_current_thread_vars = (cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t *)Mem_Alloc(sizeof(cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t));
00214     
00215     /* panic !!! */
00216     if (p_current_thread_vars == NULL) {
00217       printf( "%p:commands_Cache_inode: Not enough memory\n",(caddr_t)pthread_self());
00218       return NULL;
00219     }
00220     
00221     /* Clean thread context */
00222         
00223     memset(  p_current_thread_vars, 0, sizeof( cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t ) );
00224     
00225     p_current_thread_vars->is_thread_init = FALSE;
00226     p_current_thread_vars->is_client_init = FALSE;
00227     strcpy( p_current_thread_vars->current_path, "");
00228     p_current_thread_vars->pentry = NULL; 
00229     p_current_thread_vars->cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS;
00230     
00231     /* set the specific value */
00232     pthread_setspecific( thread_key , (void *)p_current_thread_vars ) ;
00233     
00234   }
00235  
00236   return p_current_thread_vars ;
00237   
00238 }/* GetCacheInodeContext */
00239 
00240 
00241 static int InitThread( cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t  * thr_info )
00242 {
00243   
00244   uid_t uid;
00245   fsal_status_t st;
00246   struct passwd * pw_struct;
00247 
00248   /* for the moment, create export context for root fileset */
00249   st = FSAL_BuildExportContext( &thr_info->exp_context,NULL, NULL );
00250     
00251   /* initialize FSAL credential for this thread */
00252 
00253   st = FSAL_InitClientContext( &thr_info->context );
00254     
00255   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00256   {    
00257     printf( "%p:commands_Cache_inode: Error %d initing contexte for thread (FSAL_InitThreadCred)\n",
00258         (caddr_t)pthread_self(),st.major);
00259     return 1;
00260   }
00261   
00262   uid = getuid();
00263   
00264   pw_struct = getpwuid(uid); 
00265   
00266   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
00267   {
00268     printf( "commands_Cache_inode: Unknown user %u\n", uid );
00269     return 1;
00270   }
00271   
00272   st = FSAL_GetClientContext( &thr_info->context, &thr_info->exp_context,
00273                               uid, pw_struct->pw_gid, NULL , 0 );
00274 
00275   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00276     {
00277       printf( "%p:commands_Cache_inode: Error %d getting contexte for uid %d (FSAL_GetUserCred)\n",
00278         (caddr_t)pthread_self(),st.major,uid);
00279       return 1;
00280     }
00281   
00282   thr_info->is_thread_init = TRUE;
00283     
00284   return 0;
00285   
00286 }
00287 
00288 
00289 static int InitClient( cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t  * thr_info )
00290 {
00291   thr_info->pentry = pentry_root ;
00292 
00293   strcpy( thr_info->current_path, "/" ); 
00294     
00295   /* Init the cache_inode client */
00296   if( cache_inode_client_init( &thr_info->client, cache_client_param, 0, NULL ) != 0 )
00297     return 1 ;
00298   
00299   /* Init the cache content client */
00300   if( cache_content_client_init( &thr_info->dc_client, datacache_client_param ) != 0 )
00301     return 1  ;
00302 
00303   thr_info->client.pcontent_client = (caddr_t)&thr_info->dc_client ;
00304 
00305   thr_info->is_client_init = TRUE;
00306     
00307   return 0;
00308   
00309 }
00310 
00311 cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * RetrieveInitializedContext()    
00312 {
00313   
00314   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;
00315   
00316   context = GetCacheInodeContext();
00317   
00318   if ( context->is_thread_init != TRUE )
00319     if ( InitThread( context ) )
00320     {
00321       printf( "Error occured during thread initialization.\n" ) ;
00322       return NULL;
00323     }
00324   
00325   if ( context->is_client_init != TRUE )
00326     if ( InitClient( context ) )
00327     {
00328       printf( "Error occured during client initialization.\n" ) ;
00329       return NULL;
00330     }
00331   
00332   return context;
00333     
00334 }

00336 
00337 void Cache_inode_layer_SetLogLevel(int log_lvl  ){
00338   
00339   log_stream_t * curr;
00340 
00341   /* mutex pour proteger le descriptor de log */
00342   pthread_mutex_lock( &mutex_log );
00343       
00344   /* first time */
00345   if ( log_level == -1){
00346     log_level = log_lvl;
00347     voie_cache.fd = fileno( stderr ) ;
00348     AddLogStreamJd( &log_desc_cache, V_FD,voie_cache,log_level,SUP);
00349   } 
00350   else 
00351     {
00352       log_level = log_lvl;
00353       /* changing log level */
00354       curr = log_desc_cache.liste_voies;
00355       while (curr){
00356         curr->niveau = log_level;
00357         curr = curr->suivante;
00358       }
00359     }
00360    
00361   /* mutex pour proteger le descriptor de log */
00362   pthread_mutex_unlock( &mutex_log );
00363 
00364 }

00378 static void getopt_init()
00379 {

00381   Opterr = 0; 
00382   
00383   /* reinits getopt processing */
00384   Optind = 1;
00385

00387 
00388 /* solves a relative or aboslute path */
00389 int cache_solvepath(char * io_global_path, int size_global_path,    /* global path */
00390                     char * i_spec_path,                          /* specified path */
00391                     cache_entry_t *  current_pentry,    /* current directory handle */
00392                     cache_entry_t ** pnew_pentry, 
00393                     FILE * output)
00394 {
00395   char str_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00396 
00397   fsal_name_t name;
00398   fsal_status_t st;
00399   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN] ;
00400   char * next_name ;
00401   char * curr ;
00402   int last=0;
00403 
00404   cache_inode_fsal_data_t fsdata ;
00405   
00406   cache_entry_t * pentry_lookup = NULL ;
00407   cache_entry_t * pentry_tmp    = NULL ;
00408   fsal_attrib_list_t attrlookup ;
00409   
00410   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
00411   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
00412   
00413   /* is it a relative or an absolute path ? */
00414   strncpy(str_path, i_spec_path ,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00415   
00416   curr = str_path;
00417   next_name = str_path;
00418 
00419   if (str_path[0] == '@')
00420     {
00421       /* It is a file handle */
00422     int rc;
00423     
00424     rc = sscanHandle( &(fsdata.handle), str_path+1 );
00425     
00426     if ( rc<=0 ){
00427       fprintf( output, "Invalid FileHandle: %s\n",str_path );
00428       return -1;
00429     }
00430     
00431     if ( str_path[rc+1] != '\0' )
00432     {
00433       fprintf( output, "Invalid FileHandle: %s\n",str_path );
00434       return -1;
00435     }
00436     
00437     /* Get the corresponding pentry */
00438     fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
00439     if( ( pentry_tmp =  cache_inode_get( &fsdata, 
00440                                          &attrlookup, 
00441                                          ht,
00442                                          &context->client, 
00443                                          &context->context, 
00444                                          &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00445       {
00446         log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_get( \"%s\" ) : %J%r\n",
00447                str_path, ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
00448         
00449         return context->cache_status ;
00450       }
00451     
00452     strncpy( io_global_path, str_path ,size_global_path);
00453     *pnew_pentry = pentry_tmp ;
00454     
00455     return 0;        
00456     
00457     }
00458   else if (str_path[0] == '/')
00459     {
00460       /* absolute path, starting from "/", with a relative path */
00461       curr ++;
00462       next_name ++;
00463       pentry_lookup = pentry_root ;
00464       strncpy(tmp_path, "/" ,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00465       
00466       /* the the directory  is /, return */
00467       if (str_path[1]=='\0')
00468         {
00469           strncpy(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);       
00470           *pnew_pentry = pentry_lookup ;
00471           return 0;
00472         }
00473       
00474     } 
00475   else 
00476     {
00477       pentry_lookup = current_pentry ;
00478       strncpy(tmp_path, io_global_path ,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);  
00479     }
00480 
00481   /* Now, the path is a relative path, proceed a step by step lookup */
00482   do 
00483     {
00484       
00485       /* tokenize to the next '/' */         
00486       while( ( curr[0] != '\0' ) &&  
00487              ( curr[0] != '/' ) )
00488         curr++;
00489       
00490       
00491       if (!curr[0]) 
00492         last=1; /* remembers if it was the last dir */
00493 
00494       curr[0]='\0';
00495       
00496       /* build the name */
00497       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st = FSAL_str2name( next_name, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, &name ) ) )
00498         {
00499           fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
00500           print_fsal_status(output,st);
00501           fprintf(output,"\n");
00502           return st.major;
00503         }
00504       
00505       /* lookup this name */
00506       
00507       if( ( pentry_tmp = cache_inode_lookup( pentry_lookup,
00508                                              &name, 
00509                                              &attrlookup, 
00510                                              ht, 
00511                                              &context->client, 
00512                                              &context->context,
00513                                              &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00514         {
00515          log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_lookup( \"%s\", \"%s\" ) : %J%r\n",
00516                tmp_path,name.name, ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
00517           
00518           return context->cache_status ;
00519         }
00520     
00521     /* updates current handle */
00522     pentry_lookup = pentry_tmp ;
00523     
00524     
00525     /* adds /name at the end of the path */
00526     strncat(tmp_path,"/",FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00527     strncat(tmp_path,next_name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00528     
00529     /* updates cursors */
00530     if( !last )
00531       {
00532         curr ++;
00533         next_name = curr ;
00534         /* ignore successive slashes */
00535         while((curr[0]!='\0') && (curr[0]=='/')){
00536           curr++;
00537           next_name = curr;
00538         }
00539         if (!curr[0]) last=1; /* it is the last dir */
00540       }
00541     
00542     } while( !last );
00543   
00544   /* everything is OK, apply changes */
00545   clean_path(tmp_path,size_global_path);
00546   strncpy(io_global_path,tmp_path,size_global_path);   
00547     
00548   *pnew_pentry = pentry_lookup ;
00549   return 0;
00550   
00551 }
00552 
00553 int cacheinode_init(char * filename,
00554                      int flag_v,
00555                      FILE * output
00556     )
00557 {
00558   int rc;
00559 
00560   fsal_status_t   status;
00561   fsal_path_t __attribute__(( __unused__ )) pathroot ;
00562   fsal_handle_t root_handle ;
00563   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs ;
00564 
00565   cache_inode_fsal_data_t fsdata ;
00566   cache_inode_parameter_t cache_param ;
00567   config_file_t config_file;
00568   
00569   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t  * context;
00570 
00571   /* geting the hostname */
00572   if( gethostname( localmachine, sizeof( localmachine ) ) != 0 )
00573     {
00574       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_GETHOSTNAME, errno ) ;
00575       exit( 1 ) ;
00576     }
00577   else
00578     SetNameHost( localmachine ) ;
00579 
00580   /* Parse config file */
00581   if( ( config_file = config_ParseFile( filename ) ) == NULL )
00582     {
00583       fprintf( output, "init_cache: Error parsing %s: %s\n", filename,  config_GetErrorMsg() );
00584       return -1;
00585     }
00586   
00587   /* creating log */
00588   AddFamilyError( ERR_CACHE_INODE, "Cache_inode related Errors", tab_errstatus_cache_inode ) ;
00589   
00590   
00591   /* creates thread context */  
00592   
00593   context = GetCacheInodeContext();
00594   
00595   if ( context->is_thread_init != TRUE )
00596     if ( InitThread( context ) )
00597     {
00598       fprintf( output, "Error ossured during thread initialization.\n" ) ;
00599       return 1;
00600     }
00601     
00602   /* Reading the hash parameter */
00603   rc = cache_inode_read_conf_hash_parameter( config_file, &cache_param );
00604   if( rc != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00605     {
00606       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_read_conf_hash_parameter : %J%r\n",
00607                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, rc );
00608 
00609       return 1 ;
00610     }
00611 
00612   cache_param.hparam.hash_func_key    = cache_inode_fsal_hash_func ;
00613   cache_param.hparam.hash_func_rbt    = cache_inode_fsal_rbt_func ;
00614   cache_param.hparam.compare_key      = cache_inode_compare_key_fsal ;
00615   cache_param.hparam.key_to_str       = NULL ;
00616   cache_param.hparam.val_to_str       = NULL ;
00617 
00618   if( flag_v )
00619     cache_inode_print_conf_hash_parameter( output, cache_param ) ;
00620   
00621   if( ( ht = cache_inode_init( cache_param, &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00622     {
00623       fprintf( output, "Error %d while init hash\n ", context->cache_status ) ;
00624       return 1 ;
00625     }
00626   else
00627    if (flag_v) fprintf( output, "\tHash Table address = %p\n", ht ) ;
00628 
00629    /* Get the gc policy */
00630   rc = cache_inode_read_conf_gc_policy( config_file, &gcpol );
00631   if( rc != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00632     {
00633       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_read_conf_gc_policy : %J%r\n",
00634                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, rc );
00635       return 1 ;
00636     }
00637 
00638   if( flag_v )
00639     cache_inode_print_conf_gc_policy( output, gcpol ) ;
00640 
00641 
00642   /* retrieve lower layer info */
00643 
00644   /* Getting the root of the FS */
00645 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00646   /*if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = FSAL_str2path( "/users/thomas/./", FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, &pathroot ) ) ) */
00647   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = FSAL_str2path( "/", FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, &pathroot ) ) )
00648     {
00649       DisplayErrorFlux( output, ERR_FSAL, status.major, status.minor);
00650       return 1 ;
00651     }
00652 
00653   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = FSAL_lookupPath( &pathroot, &context->context, &root_handle, NULL ) ) )
00654     {
00655       DisplayErrorFlux( output, ERR_FSAL, status.major, status.minor);
00656       return 1 ;
00657     }
00658 #else
00659   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = FSAL_lookup( NULL, NULL, &context->context, &root_handle, NULL ) ) )
00660     {
00661       DisplayErrorFlux( output, ERR_FSAL, status.major, status.minor);
00662       return 1 ;
00663     }
00664 #endif
00665 
00666   /* retrieve supported attributes */
00667     
00668   FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes );
00669   FSAL_SET_MASK( attrs.asked_attributes, FSAL_ATTR_SUPPATTR );
00670   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = FSAL_getattrs( &root_handle, &context->context, &attrs ) ) )
00671     {
00672       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_getattrs:" );
00673       print_fsal_status( output, status );
00674       fprintf(output,"\n");
00675       return status.major;
00676     }
00677 
00678 
00679   
00680   cache_client_param.log_outputs = log_desc_cache;
00681   cache_client_param.attrmask = attrs.supported_attributes;
00682   
00683   cache_client_param.lru_param.entry_to_str = lru_entry_to_str ;
00684   cache_client_param.lru_param.clean_entry = lru_clean_entry ;
00685 #ifdef _USE_ASYNC_CACHE_INODE
00686   cache_client_param.atd_sleeptime       = CACHE_INODE_ASYNC_DEFAULT_SLEEP_TIME ;
00687   cache_client_param.nb_synclet          = CACHE_INODE_ASYNC_DEFAULT_NB_SYNCLETS ;
00688   cache_client_param.nb_pre_create_dirs  = CACHE_INODE_ASYNC_DEFAULT_NB_PREALLOCATED_DIRS ;
00689   cache_client_param.nb_pre_create_files = CACHE_INODE_ASYNC_DEFAULT_NB_PREALLOCATED_FILES ;
00690 
00691   cache_client_param.lru_async_param.nb_entry_prealloc = 512 ;
00692   cache_client_param.lru_async_param.entry_to_str      = lru_entry_to_str ;
00693   cache_client_param.lru_async_param.clean_entry       = lru_clean_entry ;
00694 #endif
00695 
00696   /* We need a cache_client to acces the cache */
00697   rc = cache_inode_read_conf_client_parameter( config_file, &cache_client_param );
00698   if( rc != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00699     {
00700       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_read_conf_client_parameter : %J%r\n",
00701                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, rc );
00702       return 1 ;
00703     }
00704 
00705   /* We need a cache_client to acces the datacache */
00706   rc = cache_content_read_conf_client_parameter( config_file, &datacache_client_param );
00707   if( rc != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00708     {
00709       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_content_read_conf_client_parameter : %J%r\n",
00710                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, rc );
00711       return 1 ;
00712     }
00713   datacache_client_param.log_outputs = log_desc_cache;
00714 /*
00715   DEPRECATED :
00716   datacache_client_param.lru_param.entry_to_str = lru_entry_to_str ;
00717   datacache_client_param.lru_param.clean_entry = lru_clean_entry ;
00718 */
00719   if( flag_v )
00720     {
00721       
00722       cache_inode_print_conf_client_parameter( output, cache_client_param ) ;
00723       cache_content_print_conf_client_parameter( output, datacache_client_param ) ;
00724     }
00725 
00726   
00727   /* Reading the datacache core parameter */
00728   if( rc != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00729     {
00730       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_content_read_conf_core_parameter : %J%r\n",
00731                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, rc );
00732       return 1 ;
00733     }
00734   
00735   
00736   /* Init the cache_inode client */
00737   if( cache_inode_client_init( &context->client, cache_client_param, 0, NULL ) != 0 )
00738     return 1 ;
00739   
00740 #ifdef _USE_ASYNC_CACHE_INODE
00741   /* Start the TAD and synclets for writeback cache inode */
00742   cache_inode_async_init( cache_client_param ) ;
00743 
00744 
00745   if( cache_inode_async_precreate_object( &context->client, DIR_BEGINNING, &context->exp_context ) == -1 )
00746     { 
00747        DisplayLog( "NFS INIT: /!\\ Impossible to pre-create asynchronous direcory pool" ) ;
00748        exit( 1 ) ;
00749     }
00750   
00751   if( cache_inode_async_precreate_object( &context->client, REGULAR_FILE, &context->exp_context ) == -1 )
00752     { 
00753        DisplayLog( "NFS INIT: /!\\ Impossible to pre-create asynchronous file pool" ) ;
00754        exit( 1 ) ;
00755     }
00756 #endif 
00757 
00758   /* Init the cache content client */
00759   if( cache_content_client_init( &context->dc_client, datacache_client_param ) != 0 )
00760     return 1  ;
00761 
00762   context->client.pcontent_client = (caddr_t)&context->dc_client ;
00763 
00764   fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
00765   fsdata.handle = root_handle ; 
00766 
00767   if( ( context->pentry = cache_inode_make_root( &fsdata, ht, &context->client,
00768                                                  &context->context, &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00769     {
00770       DisplayLogFlux( output, "Error: can't init fs's root" ) ;
00771       return 1 ;
00772     }
00773 
00774   if( cache_content_init_dir( datacache_client_param, EXPORT_ID ) != 0  )
00775     {
00776       DisplayLogFlux( output, "Error: can't init datacache directory" ) ;
00777       return 1 ;
00778     }
00779  
00780   strcpy( context->current_path, "/" ) ;
00781   
00782   context->is_client_init = TRUE;
00783   
00784   pentry_root = context->pentry ;
00785   
00786   if (flag_v) fprintf( output, "\tCache_inode successfully initialized.\n" ) ;
00787 
00788   cache_init = TRUE;
00789   
00790   /* Free config struct */  
00791   config_Free( config_file );
00792   
00793   return 0;
00794 }
00795 
00797 int fn_Cache_inode_cache_init( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00798                                char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00799                                FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
00800 {
00801   int rc;
00802     
00803   int flag_v   = 0;
00804   int flag_h   = 0;  
00805   int err_flag = 0 ;
00806   int option ;
00807   char * filename = NULL;
00808 
00809   static char format[]="hv";
00810   
00811   static char help_init[]=
00812     "usage: init_cache [options] <ganesha_config_file>\n"
00813     "options :\n"
00814     "\t-h print this help\n"
00815     "\t-v verbose mode\n";
00816 
00817   if( ht != NULL )
00818     {
00819       fprintf( output, "\tCache_inode is already initialized\n" ) ;
00820       return 0 ;
00821     }
00822   
00823   /* analysing options */
00824   getopt_init();
00825   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
00826     {   
00827       switch( option )
00828         {
00829         case 'v':
00830           if( flag_v )
00831             fprintf( output,
00832                     "init_cache: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n"); 
00833           else 
00834             flag_v++;
00835           break;
00836           
00837         case 'h':
00838           if( flag_h )
00839             fprintf( output,
00840                      "init_cache: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n") ;
00841           else 
00842             flag_h++;
00843           break;
00844           
00845       case '?':
00846         fprintf( output, "init_fs: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt ) ;
00847         err_flag ++;
00848         break;
00849         } /* switch */   
00850     } /* while */
00851   
00852   if( flag_h )
00853     {
00854       fprintf( output, help_init );
00855       return 0;
00856     }
00857 
00858   /* verifies mandatory argument */
00859   if( Optind != ( argc -1 ) )
00860     {
00861       /* too much or not enough arguments */
00862       err_flag ++;
00863     } 
00864   else 
00865     filename = argv[Optind];
00866   
00867   if( err_flag )
00868     {
00869       fprintf(output,help_init);
00870       return -1;
00871     }
00872 
00873   rc = cacheinode_init(filename, flag_v, output);
00874 
00875   return rc;
00876 }
00877 
00878 
00879 
00881 int fn_Cache_inode_pwd( int argc ,          /* IN : number of args in argv */
00882                         char ** argv ,      /* IN : arg list               */
00883                         FILE * output   )   /* IN : output stream          */
00884 {
00885    fsal_handle_t        * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
00886    char buff[128];
00887    
00888   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
00889   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
00890   
00891   if( ! cache_init )
00892     {
00893       fprintf( output, "Error: Cache is not initialized\n" ) ;
00894       return -1 ;
00895     }
00896 
00897   if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( context->pentry, &context->cache_status) ) == NULL )
00898     {
00899       return 1 ;
00900     }
00901   
00902   fprintf( output, "Current directory is \"%s\" \n", context->current_path ) ;
00903   snprintmem( buff, 128, (caddr_t)pfsal_handle, sizeof( fsal_handle_t ) ) ;
00904   fprintf( output, "Current File handle is \"@%s\" \n", buff ) ; 
00905 
00906   return 0;
00907     
00908 }
00909 
00911 int fn_Cache_inode_cd( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00912         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00913         FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
00914 {
00915   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00916   
00917   cache_entry_t *  new_pentry;
00918   int rc ;
00919   
00920   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
00921   
00922   static char help_cd[]=
00923     "usage: cd <path>\n";
00924     
00925   if( ! cache_init )
00926     {
00927       fprintf( output, "\tCache is not initialized\n" ) ;
00928       return -1 ;
00929     }
00930   
00931   /* Exactly one arg expected */
00932   if (argc!=2){
00933     fprintf(output,help_cd);
00934     return -1;
00935   }
00936   
00937   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
00938   
00939   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
00940   
00941   if(  ( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, argv[1], context->pentry , &new_pentry, output ) ) != 0 )
00942     return rc ;
00943   
00944   if( new_pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING )
00945     {
00946       fprintf(output,"Error: %s is not a directory\n",glob_path);  
00947       return ENOTDIR;
00948     }
00949 
00950   if( ( context->cache_status = cache_inode_access( new_pentry, 
00951                                                     FSAL_X_OK, 
00952                                                     ht, 
00953                                                     &context->client, 
00954                                                     &context->context, 
00955                                                     &context->cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00956     {
00957       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_access : %J%r\n",
00958                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
00959       return context->cache_status ;
00960     }    
00961     
00962     
00963   /* if so, apply changes */  
00964   strncpy(context->current_path,glob_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);   
00965   context->pentry = new_pentry;
00966   
00967   fprintf(output,"Current directory is \"%s\"\n", context->current_path ); 
00968 
00969   return 0;      
00970 }
00971 
00972 
00974 int fn_Cache_inode_stat( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
00975         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
00976         FILE * output   )  /* IN : output stream          */
00977 {
00978   static char format[]="hv";
00979    
00980   static char help_stat[]="usage: stat [-h][-v] <file>\n";
00981 
00982   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
00983   cache_entry_t * pentry_stat = NULL ;
00984   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs;
00985 
00986   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
00987 
00988   int rc,option;
00989   int flag_v=0;
00990   int flag_h=0;
00991   int err_flag=0;
00992   char * file = NULL;
00993   
00994   if( ! cache_init )
00995     {
00996       fprintf( output, "\tCache_inode is not initialized\n" ) ;
00997       return -1 ;
00998     }
00999  
01000   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01001 
01002   /* analysing options */
01003   getopt_init();  
01004     
01005   while ((option = Getopt(argc, argv, format)) != -1){ 
01006     
01007     switch(option){
01008       case 'v':
01009         if (flag_v)
01010           fprintf(output,
01011               "stat: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01012         else flag_v++;
01013         break;
01014       case 'h':
01015         if ( flag_h )
01016           fprintf(output,
01017               "stat: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01018         else flag_h++;
01019         break;
01020       case '?':
01021         fprintf(output,"stat: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01022         err_flag ++;
01023         break;
01024     }    
01025   }
01026   
01027   /* Exactly one arg expected */
01028   if (Optind != (argc-1)){
01029     err_flag ++;
01030   } else {
01031     file = argv[Optind];
01032   }
01033   
01034   if (err_flag){
01035     fprintf(output,help_stat);
01036     return -1;
01037   }
01038     
01039   /* copy current path. */
01040   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01041   
01042   /* retrieves object handle*/
01043   if (rc = cache_solvepath(glob_path,
01044                            FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
01045                            file, 
01046                            context->pentry, 
01047                            &pentry_stat,
01048                            output ) )
01049     return rc;
01050 
01051   /* Get the attributes */
01052   if( cache_inode_getattr( pentry_stat,
01053                            &attrs,
01054                            ht, 
01055                            &context->client, 
01056                            &context->context, 
01057                            &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01058     {
01059      log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_getattr( \"%s\" ) : %J%r\n",
01060                   file, ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
01061 
01062       return context->cache_status ;
01063     }
01064 
01065   /* print file attributes */
01066   print_fsal_attributes( attrs, output);
01067 
01068   return 0 ;
01069 }
01070 
01071 
01073 int fn_Cache_inode_gc( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01074                        char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01075                        FILE * output  )   /* IN : output stream          */
01076 {
01077   static char format[]="hv" ;
01078   
01079   static char help_gc[]="usage: gc \n"
01080     "options :\n"
01081     "\t-h print this help\n"
01082     "   The gc policy used is defined in the configuration file\n" ;
01083   
01084    int option;
01085    int flag_v = 0;
01086    int flag_h = 0;
01087    int err_flag = 0;
01088 
01089   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
01090    
01091    /* is the fs initialized ? */
01092    if( ! cache_init )
01093     {
01094       fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
01095       return -1;
01096     }
01097 
01098   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01099   
01100   /* analysing options */
01101   getopt_init();
01102   
01103   while ( (option = Getopt(argc, argv, format) ) != -1)
01104     {   
01105       switch( option )
01106         {
01107         case 'v':
01108           if( flag_v )
01109             fprintf(output,
01110                     "ls: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01111           else
01112             flag_v++;
01113           break;
01114 
01115         case 'h':
01116           if( flag_h )
01117             fprintf(output,
01118                     "ls: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01119           else 
01120             flag_h++;
01121           break;
01122 
01123         case '?':
01124           fprintf(output,"ls: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01125           err_flag ++;
01126           break;
01127         }
01128     } /* while */
01129   
01130   if( flag_h )
01131     {
01132       fprintf(output,help_gc);
01133       return 0;
01134     }
01135   
01136   if( err_flag )
01137     {
01138       fprintf(output,help_gc);
01139       return -1;
01140     }
01141   
01142   
01143   cache_inode_set_gc_policy( gcpol ) ;
01144 
01145   if( cache_inode_gc( ht, &context->client, &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01146     {
01147       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_gc : %J%r\n",
01148                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01149       return context->cache_status ;
01150     }
01151 
01152   return 0 ;
01153 } /* fn_Cache_inode_gc */
01154 
01155 
01157 int fn_Cache_inode_ls( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01158                        char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01159                        FILE * output  )   /* IN : output stream          */
01160 {
01161 #define CACHE_INODE_SHELL_READDIR_SIZE 10
01162   unsigned int begin_cookie = 0 ;
01163   unsigned int end_cookie = 0 ;
01164   unsigned int nbfound ;
01165   cache_inode_dir_entry_t dirent_array[CACHE_INODE_SHELL_READDIR_SIZE] ;
01166   unsigned int  cookie_array[CACHE_INODE_SHELL_READDIR_SIZE] ;
01167   cache_inode_endofdir_t eod_met ;
01168   unsigned int i ;
01169   fsal_path_t symlink_path;
01170   fsal_attrib_list_t attrs;
01171   char * str_name = "." ;
01172   char item_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01173   cache_entry_t * pentry_tmp = NULL ;
01174 
01175   int rc = 0 ;
01176   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01177   fsal_handle_t        * pfsal_handle = NULL ;
01178 
01179   static char format[]="hvdlLSHz";
01180   static char help_ls[]="usage: ls [options]\n"
01181     "options :\n"
01182     "\t-h print this help\n"
01183     "\t-v verbose mode\n"  
01184     "\t-d print directory info instead of listing its content\n"      
01185     "\t-l print standard UNIX attributes\n"
01186     "\t-L print the cache_inode entry addresses\n" 
01187     "\t-S print all supported attributes\n"
01188     "\t-H print the fsal handle\n" 
01189     "\t-z silent mode (print nothing)\n" ;
01190   
01191   int option;
01192   int flag_v = 0;
01193   int flag_h = 0;
01194   int flag_d = 0;
01195   int flag_l = 0;
01196   int flag_S = 0;
01197   int flag_L = 0 ;
01198   int flag_H = 0 ;
01199   int flag_z = 0 ;
01200   int err_flag = 0;
01201   
01202   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
01203    
01204    /* is the fs initialized ? */
01205    if( ! cache_init )
01206     {
01207       fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
01208       return -1;
01209     }
01210 
01211   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01212 
01213   /* analysing options */
01214   getopt_init();
01215 
01216   while ( (option = Getopt(argc, argv, format) ) != -1)
01217     {   
01218       switch( option )
01219         {
01220         case 'v':
01221           if (flag_v)
01222             fprintf(output,
01223                     "ls: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01224           else 
01225             flag_v++;
01226           break;
01227           
01228         case 'h':
01229           if ( flag_h )
01230             fprintf(output,
01231                     "ls: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01232           else 
01233             flag_h++;
01234           break;
01235           
01236         case 'd':
01237           if ( flag_d )
01238             fprintf(output,
01239                     "ls: warning: option 'd' has been specified more than once.\n");
01240           else 
01241             flag_d++;
01242           break;
01243           
01244         case 'l':
01245           if ( flag_l )
01246             fprintf(output,
01247                     "ls: warning: option 'l' has been specified more than once.\n");
01248           else 
01249             flag_l++;
01250           break;
01251           
01252         case 'L':
01253           if ( flag_L )
01254             fprintf(output,
01255                     "ls: warning: option 'L' has been specified more than once.\n");
01256           else 
01257             flag_L++;
01258           break;
01259           
01260         case 'S':
01261           if ( flag_S )
01262             fprintf(output,
01263                     "ls: warning: option 'S' has been specified more than once.\n");
01264           else 
01265             flag_S++;
01266           break;
01267           
01268         case 'z':
01269           if ( flag_z )
01270             fprintf(output,
01271                     "ls: warning: option 'z' has been specified more than once.\n");
01272           else 
01273             flag_z++;
01274           break;
01275 
01276         case 'H':
01277           if( flag_H )
01278             fprintf(output,
01279                     "ls: warning: option 'H' has been specified more than once.\n");
01280           else 
01281             flag_H++;
01282           break;
01283           
01284         case '?':
01285           fprintf(output,"ls: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
01286           err_flag ++;
01287           break;
01288         }
01289     } /* while */
01290   
01291   if( flag_l + flag_S + flag_L + flag_H > 1 )
01292     {
01293       fprintf(output,"ls: conflict between options l,S,L\n");
01294       err_flag++;
01295     }
01296 
01297   if( flag_z + flag_v > 1 )
01298     {
01299       fprintf( output, "ls: can't use -z and -v at the same time\n" ) ;
01300       err_flag ++ ;
01301     }
01302   
01303   if( flag_h )
01304     {
01305       fprintf(output,help_ls);
01306       return 0;
01307     }
01308   
01309   if( err_flag )
01310     {
01311       fprintf(output,help_ls);
01312       return -1;
01313     }
01314   
01315   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01316 
01317   /* first, retrieve the argument (if any) */
01318   if( Optind == argc -1  )
01319     { 
01320       str_name = argv[Optind];
01321       
01322       /* retrieving handle */  
01323       if (rc = cache_solvepath(glob_path,
01324                                FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
01325                                str_name, 
01326                                context->pentry, 
01327                                &pentry_tmp, 
01328                                output))
01329         return rc;
01330       
01331     } 
01332   else 
01333     {
01334       str_name = ".";
01335       pentry_tmp = context->pentry ;
01336     }
01337   
01338   if( flag_v )
01339     fprintf(output,"proceeding ls (via Cache_inode) on \"%s\"\n", glob_path ) ;
01340 
01341   
01342 
01343   /*
01344   * if the object is a file or a directoy with the -d option specified,
01345   * we only show its info and exit.
01346   */  
01347   if ( (pentry_tmp->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING ) || flag_d )
01348     {
01349       if ( pentry_tmp->internal_md.type == SYMBOLIC_LINK )
01350         {
01351           if( cache_inode_readlink( pentry_tmp, 
01352                                     &symlink_path, 
01353                                     ht, 
01354                                     &context->client, 
01355                                     &context->context, 
01356                                     &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01357             {
01358               if( !flag_z) 
01359                 log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_readlink : %J%r\n",
01360                              ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01361               
01362               return context->cache_status ;
01363             }
01364         }
01365       
01366       if( cache_inode_getattr( pentry_tmp, 
01367                                &attrs,
01368                                ht, 
01369                                &context->client, 
01370                                &context->context, 
01371                                &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01372         {
01373           if( !flag_z) 
01374                 log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_getattr : %J%r\n",
01375                              ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01376                       
01377           return context->cache_status ;
01378         }
01379 
01380       if( flag_l )
01381         {
01382           if( !flag_z )
01383             print_item_line( output, &attrs, str_name, symlink_path.path);
01384         }
01385       else if( flag_S )
01386         {
01387           if( !flag_z )
01388             {
01389               fprintf(output,"%s :\n",str_name);
01390               print_fsal_attributes( attrs, output);
01391             }
01392         } 
01393       else if( flag_H )
01394         {
01395           if( !flag_z )
01396             {
01397               char buff[128] ;
01398               
01399               if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry_tmp, &context->cache_status) ) == NULL )
01400                 {
01401                   return 1 ;
01402                 }
01403               snprintmem( buff, 128, (caddr_t)pfsal_handle, sizeof( fsal_handle_t ) ) ;
01404               fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", str_name, buff ) ;
01405             }
01406         }
01407       else if( flag_L ) 
01408         {
01409           if( !flag_z )
01410             {
01411               if( context->pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
01412                 fprintf(output,"%p N/A  \t\t%s\n", pentry_tmp, str_name);
01413               else
01414                 {
01415                   if( context->pentry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
01416                     fprintf(output,"%p (not cached) \t%s\n", context->pentry, str_name ) ;
01417                   else
01418                     fprintf(output,"%p %p \t%s\n", 
01419                             context->pentry, 
01420                             context->pentry->object.file.pentry_content, 
01421                             str_name ) ;
01422                 }
01423             }
01424         }
01425       else  /* only prints the name */
01426         {
01427           if( !flag_z )
01428             fprintf(output,"%s\n",str_name);
01429         }
01430       
01431       return 0;
01432     }
01433   
01434   /* If this point is reached, then the pentry is a directory */
01435   
01436   begin_cookie = 0 ;
01437   eod_met = UNASSIGNED_EOD ;
01438   while( eod_met != END_OF_DIR )
01439     {
01440       
01441       if( flag_v )
01442          fprintf( output, "-->cache_inode_readdir(path=%s,cookie=%d)\n",
01443                   glob_path,
01444                   begin_cookie  ) ;
01445        
01446       
01447       if( cache_inode_readdir( pentry_tmp, 
01448                                begin_cookie, 
01449                                CACHE_INODE_SHELL_READDIR_SIZE, 
01450                                &nbfound,
01451                                &end_cookie,
01452                                &eod_met, 
01453                                dirent_array, 
01454                                cookie_array,
01455                                ht, 
01456                                &context->client, 
01457                                &context->context, 
01458                                &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01459         {
01460           fprintf( output, "Error %d in cache_inode_readdir\n", context->cache_status ) ;
01461           return context->cache_status ;
01462         }
01463     
01464 
01465       for( i = 0 ; i < nbfound ; i++ )
01466         {
01467           if (!strcmp(str_name,"."))
01468             strncpy(item_path,dirent_array[i].name.name,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01469           else if (str_name[strlen(str_name)-1] == '/')
01470             snprintf(item_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,"%s%s",str_name,dirent_array[i].name.name);
01471           else
01472             snprintf(item_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,"%s/%s",str_name,dirent_array[i].name.name);
01473           
01474 
01475           if( dirent_array[i].pentry->internal_md.type == SYMBOLIC_LINK )
01476             {
01477               if( cache_inode_readlink(  dirent_array[i].pentry,
01478                                          &symlink_path, 
01479                                          ht, 
01480                                          &context->client, 
01481                                          &context->context, 
01482                                          &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01483                 {
01484                   log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_readlink : %J%r\n",
01485                              ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01486                   return context->cache_status ;
01487                 }
01488             }
01489           
01490           if( flag_l )
01491             {
01492               if( cache_inode_getattr( dirent_array[i].pentry,
01493                                        &attrs,
01494                                        ht, 
01495                                        &context->client, 
01496                                        &context->context, 
01497                                        &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01498                 {
01499                   log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_getattr : %J%r\n",
01500                              ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01501                   
01502                   return context->cache_status ;
01503                 }
01504               
01505               print_item_line( output, &attrs, item_path, symlink_path.path);
01506             }
01507           else if( flag_S )
01508             {
01509               fprintf(output,"%s :\n",item_path);
01510               if( cache_inode_getattr( dirent_array[i].pentry,
01511                                        &attrs,
01512                                        ht, 
01513                                        &context->client, 
01514                                        &context->context, 
01515                                        &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01516                 {
01517                   log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_getattr : %J%r\n",
01518                              ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01519                   return context->cache_status ;
01520                 }
01521               if( !flag_z )
01522                 print_fsal_attributes( attrs, output);
01523             }
01524           else if( flag_L )
01525             {
01526               if( !flag_z )
01527                 {
01528                   if( dirent_array[i].pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
01529                     fprintf(output,"%p N/A \t\t%s\n", dirent_array[i].pentry, item_path);
01530                   else
01531                     {
01532                       if( dirent_array[i].pentry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
01533                         fprintf(output,"%p (not cached) \t%s\n", dirent_array[i].pentry, item_path);
01534                       else
01535                         fprintf(output,"%p %p \t%s\n", 
01536                                 dirent_array[i].pentry, 
01537                                 dirent_array[i].pentry->object.file.pentry_content, 
01538                                 item_path);
01539                     }
01540                 }
01541             }
01542           else if( flag_H )
01543             {
01544               if( !flag_z )
01545                 {
01546                   char buff[128] ;
01547                   
01548                   if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle(  dirent_array[i].pentry, &context->cache_status) ) == NULL )
01549                     {
01550                       return 1 ;
01551                     }
01552                   snprintmem( buff, 128, (caddr_t)pfsal_handle, sizeof( fsal_handle_t ) ) ;
01553                   fprintf( output, "%s (@%s)\n", item_path, buff ) ;
01554                 }
01555             }
01556           else
01557             {
01558               if( !flag_z )
01559                 fprintf(output,"%s\n",item_path);
01560             }
01561         }
01562       
01563       /* Ready for next iteration */
01564 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
01565       printf( "--------------> begin_cookie = %d, nbfound=%d, last cookie=%d, end_cookie=%d, begin_cookie + nbfound =%d\n", 
01566               begin_cookie, nbfound,  cookie_array[nbfound-1] , end_cookie, begin_cookie + nbfound ) ;
01567 #endif
01568       begin_cookie = end_cookie ;
01569     }
01570   
01571   return 0;
01572 } /* fn_Cache_inode_ls */
01573 
01574   
01575 
01577 int fn_Cache_inode_callstat( int argc ,/* IN : number of args in argv */
01578                              char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01579                              FILE * output   )  /* IN : output stream          */
01580 {
01581   int i;
01582   hash_stat_t hstat  ;
01583   
01584   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
01585    
01586    /* is the fs initialized ? */
01587    if( ! cache_init )
01588     {
01589       fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
01590       return -1;
01591     }
01592 
01593   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01594   
01595   /* displaying stats */
01596   /* header: */
01597   fprintf( output, "Function             | Nb_Calls    | Success     | Retryable   | Unrecoverable\n" );
01598   /* content */
01599   for (i=0;i<CACHE_INODE_NB_COMMAND;i++)
01600     fprintf(output,"%-20s | %11u | %11u | %11u | %11u\n",
01601           cache_inode_function_names[i],
01602           context->client.stat.func_stats.nb_call[i],
01603           context->client.stat.func_stats.nb_success[i],
01604           context->client.stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[i],
01605           context->client.stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[i]
01606           );
01607   fprintf( output, "------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" ) ;
01608   
01609   /* Statistics for the HashTable */
01610   HashTable_GetStats( ht, &hstat ) ;
01611   fprintf( output, "Operation            |     ok      |    err      |   notfound  \n" ) ;
01612   fprintf( output, "Set                  | %11u | %11u | %11u \n", 
01613            hstat.dynamic.ok.nb_set, hstat.dynamic.err.nb_set, hstat.dynamic.notfound.nb_set ) ;
01614   fprintf( output, "Test                 | %11u | %11u | %11u \n", 
01615            hstat.dynamic.ok.nb_test, hstat.dynamic.err.nb_test, hstat.dynamic.notfound.nb_test ) ;
01616   fprintf( output, "Get                  | %11u | %11u | %11u \n", 
01617            hstat.dynamic.ok.nb_get, hstat.dynamic.err.nb_get, hstat.dynamic.notfound.nb_get ) ;
01618   fprintf( output, "Del                  | %11u | %11u | %11u \n", 
01619            hstat.dynamic.ok.nb_del, hstat.dynamic.err.nb_del, hstat.dynamic.notfound.nb_del ) ;
01620   fprintf( output, "------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" ) ;
01621   fprintf( output, "There are %d entries in the Cache inode HashTable\n", hstat.dynamic.nb_entries ) ;
01622   fprintf( output, "index_size=%d  min_rbt_num_node=%d  max_rbt_num_node=%d average_rbt_num_node=%d\n", 
01623            ht->parameter.index_size, 
01624            hstat.computed.min_rbt_num_node, hstat.computed.max_rbt_num_node, hstat.computed.average_rbt_num_node ) ;
01625   fprintf( output, "------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" ) ;
01626   fprintf( output, "Client LRU_GC: nb_entry=%d, nb_invalid=%d, nb_call_gc=%d, param.nb_call_gc_invalid=%d\n", 
01627            context->client.lru_gc->nb_entry, context->client.lru_gc->nb_invalid, context->client.lru_gc->nb_call_gc, 
01628            context->client.lru_gc->parameter.nb_call_gc_invalid ) ;
01629   fprintf( output, "------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" ) ;
01630 
01631   return 0;  
01632 }
01633 
01634 
01636 int fn_Cache_inode_mkdir( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01637                    char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01638                    FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ )
01639 {
01640   
01641   
01642   static char format[]="hv";
01643    
01644   static char help_mkdir[]=
01645   "usage: mkdir [-h][-v] <path> [mode]\n"
01646   "       path: parent directory where the directory is to be created\n"
01647   "       name: name of the directory is to be created\n"
01648   "       mode: octal mode for the directory is to be created (ex: 755)\n" ;
01649 
01650   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01651   cache_entry_t * new_hdl ;
01652   cache_entry_t * subdir_hdl ;
01653   fsal_status_t st;
01654   int rc,option;
01655   int flag_v=0;
01656   int flag_h=0;
01657   int err_flag=0;
01658   int mode;
01659   fsal_accessmode_t fsalmode = 0755;
01660   fsal_attrib_list_t attrmkdir ;
01661   
01662   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01663   char * path;
01664   char * file;
01665   char * strmode;
01666   
01667   fsal_name_t objname;
01668 
01669   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
01670    
01671   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01672    if( ! cache_init )
01673    {
01674      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
01675      return -1;
01676    }
01677   
01678   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01679   
01680   /* analysing options */
01681   getopt_init();
01682   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
01683     switch( option )
01684       {
01685       case 'v':
01686         if( flag_v )
01687           fprintf( output, "mkdir: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
01688         else flag_v++;
01689         break;
01690         
01691       case 'h':
01692         if( flag_h )
01693           fprintf( output, "mkdir: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01694         else flag_h++;
01695         break;
01696         
01697       case '?':
01698         fprintf( output,"mkdir: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
01699         err_flag ++;
01700         break;
01701     }    
01702   }
01703   
01704   if( flag_h )
01705     {
01706       fprintf( output, help_mkdir);
01707       return 0;
01708     }
01709   
01710   /* Exactly 1 or 2 args expected */
01711     
01712   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) && Optind != ( argc - 1 ) )
01713     {
01714       err_flag ++;
01715     } 
01716   else 
01717     {
01718       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
01719       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
01720       
01721       if ( Optind == ( argc - 1 ) )
01722       {
01723         mode = 0755;
01724       }
01725       else
01726       {
01727         strmode = argv[Optind+1];
01728         /* converting mode string to FSAL mode string */
01729         mode = atomode( strmode );  
01730       }
01731 
01732   if( mode<0 ) 
01733     err_flag ++;
01734   else 
01735     {
01736       fsalmode = 0;
01737       
01738       if ( mode & S_ISUID ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_SUID;
01739       if ( mode & S_ISGID ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_SGID;
01740       
01741       if ( mode & S_IRUSR ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_RUSR;
01742       if ( mode & S_IWUSR ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_WUSR;
01743       if ( mode & S_IXUSR ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_XUSR;
01744       
01745       if ( mode & S_IRGRP ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_RGRP;
01746       if ( mode & S_IWGRP ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_WGRP;
01747       if ( mode & S_IXGRP ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_XGRP;
01748       
01749       if ( mode & S_IROTH ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_ROTH;
01750       if ( mode & S_IWOTH ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_WOTH;
01751       if ( mode & S_IXOTH ) fsalmode |= FSAL_MODE_XOTH;
01752       
01753     }
01754   }
01755   
01756   if( err_flag )
01757     {
01758       fprintf( output, help_mkdir );
01759       return -1;
01760     }
01761   
01762   /* copy current path. */
01763   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
01764   
01765   /* retrieves path handle*/
01766   if (rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, path, context->pentry, &new_hdl,output) )
01767     return rc;
01768   
01769 
01770   /* create fsal_name_t */
01771   st = FSAL_str2name( file, 256,&objname ) ;
01772   
01773   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
01774     {
01775       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
01776       print_fsal_status( output, st );
01777       fprintf( output, "\n" );
01778       return st.major;
01779     }
01780   
01781   subdir_hdl = cache_inode_create( new_hdl, 
01782                                    &objname, 
01783                                    DIR_BEGINNING, 
01784                                    fsalmode, 
01785                                    NULL, 
01786                                    &attrmkdir, 
01787                                    ht, 
01788                                    &context->client,
01789                                    &context->context, 
01790                                    &context->cache_status );
01791     
01792   if( ( subdir_hdl == NULL ) || ( context->cache_status != 0 )  )
01793   {
01794     log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_create(DIR_BEGINNING) : %J%r\n",
01795                  ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
01796 
01797     return context->cache_status ;
01798   }
01799 
01800   if( flag_v )
01801   {
01802     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created (handle=%p) \n",glob_path,file, subdir_hdl ) ;
01803   }
01804 
01805   return 0;  
01806 }
01807 
01809 int fn_Cache_inode_link( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01810                          char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01811                          FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ )
01812 {
01813   
01814   
01815   static char format[]="hv";
01816   
01817   static char help_hardlink[]=
01818     "hardlink: create a hard link.\n"
01819     "usage: hardlink [-h][-v] <target> <new_path>\n"
01820     "       target: path of an existing file.\n"
01821     "       new_path: path of the hardlink to be created\n";
01822   
01823   char glob_path_target[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01824   char glob_path_link[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01825 
01826   cache_entry_t * target_hdl;
01827   cache_entry_t * dir_hdl;
01828   fsal_name_t   link_name;
01829 
01830   fsal_status_t st;
01831   int rc,option;
01832   int flag_v=0;
01833   int flag_h=0;
01834   int err_flag=0;
01835   fsal_attrib_list_t attrlink ;
01836 
01837   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01838   char * target = NULL;
01839   char * path;
01840   char * name;
01841   
01842   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
01843    
01844   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01845    if( ! cache_init )
01846    {
01847      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
01848      return -1;
01849    }
01850 
01851   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01852   
01853   /* analysing options */
01854   getopt_init();
01855   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
01856     {   
01857       switch( option )
01858         {
01859         case 'v':
01860           if( flag_v )
01861             fprintf( output,
01862                      "hardlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n" );
01863           else 
01864             flag_v++;
01865           break;
01866 
01867         case 'h':
01868           if( flag_h )
01869             fprintf( output, "hardlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
01870           else 
01871             flag_h++;
01872           break;
01873           
01874       case '?':
01875         fprintf( output,"hardlink: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
01876         err_flag ++;
01877         break;
01878         }    
01879     }
01880   
01881   if( flag_h )
01882     {
01883       fprintf( output, help_hardlink );
01884       return 0;
01885     }
01886 
01887   /* There should be exactly 2 arguments */
01888   if( Optind == ( argc -2 ) )
01889     {
01890       target = argv[Optind];
01891       
01892       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[ Optind + 1 ], FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
01893       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &name );
01894     }
01895   else 
01896     {    
01897       err_flag ++;    
01898     }
01899   
01900   
01901   if( err_flag )
01902     {
01903       fprintf( output, help_hardlink );
01904       return -1;
01905     }
01906 
01907   /* copy current path. */
01908   strncpy(glob_path_target,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01909   strncpy(glob_path_link,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
01910   
01911   /* retrieves path handle*/
01912   if (rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path_target, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, target, context->pentry, &target_hdl, output) )
01913     return rc;
01914 
01915   if (rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path_link, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, path, context->pentry, &dir_hdl, output) )
01916     return rc;
01917 
01918   /* create fsal_name_t */
01919   st = FSAL_str2name( name, 256,&link_name ) ;
01920   
01921   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
01922     {
01923       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
01924       print_fsal_status( output, st );
01925       fprintf( output, "\n" );
01926       return st.major;
01927     }
01928 
01929   if( cache_inode_link( target_hdl,
01930                         dir_hdl,
01931                         &link_name, 
01932                         &attrlink, 
01933                         ht, 
01934                         &context->client,
01935                         &context->context, 
01936                         &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01937     {
01938      log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_link : %J%r\n",
01939                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
01940       return context->cache_status;
01941     }
01942 
01943   if( flag_v )
01944     {
01945       fprintf(output,"hardlink successfully created \n" ) ;
01946     }
01947 
01948   return 0;  
01949 }
01950 
01951 
01952 
01954 int fn_Cache_inode_ln( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
01955                             char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
01956                             FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ )
01957 {
01958   
01959   
01960   static char format[]="hv";
01961    
01962   static char help_ln[]=
01963   "usage: ln [-h][-v] <link_content> <link_path>\n"
01964   "       link_content: content of the symbolic link to be created\n"
01965   "       link_path: path of the symbolic link to be created\n";
01966 
01967   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01968   cache_entry_t * new_hdl ;
01969   cache_entry_t * subdir_hdl ;
01970   fsal_status_t st;
01971   int rc,option;
01972   int flag_v=0;
01973   int flag_h=0;
01974   int err_flag=0;
01975   fsal_accessmode_t fsalmode = 0777;
01976   fsal_attrib_list_t attrsymlink ;
01977   
01978   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
01979   char * path;
01980   char * file;
01981   char * content = NULL;
01982   
01983   fsal_name_t objname;
01984   
01985   cache_inode_create_arg_t create_arg;
01986   
01987   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
01988    
01989   /* is the fs initialized ? */
01990   if( !cache_init )
01991    {
01992      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
01993      return -1;
01994    }
01995 
01996   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
01997   
01998   /* analysing options */
01999   getopt_init();
02000   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02001     switch( option )
02002       {
02003       case 'v':
02004         if( flag_v )
02005           fprintf( output, "ln: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02006         else flag_v++;
02007         break;
02008         
02009       case 'h':
02010         if( flag_h )
02011           fprintf( output, "ln: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02012         else flag_h++;
02013         break;
02014         
02015       case '?':
02016         fprintf( output,"ln: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02017         err_flag ++;
02018         break;
02019     }    
02020   }
02021   
02022   if( flag_h )
02023     {
02024       fprintf( output, help_ln);
02025       return 0;
02026     }
02027   
02028   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02029   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
02030     {
02031       err_flag ++;
02032     } 
02033   else 
02034     {
02035       content = argv[Optind];
02036       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind+1], FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02037       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
02038       
02039     }
02040   
02041   if( err_flag )
02042     {
02043       fprintf( output, help_ln );
02044       return -1;
02045     }
02046   
02047   /* copy current path. */
02048   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02049   
02050   /* retrieves path handle*/
02051   if (rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, path, context->pentry, &new_hdl,output) )
02052     return rc;
02053 
02054   /* create fsal_name_t */
02055   st = FSAL_str2name( file, 256,&objname ) ;
02056   
02057   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02058     {
02059       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02060       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02061       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02062       return st.major;
02063     }
02064 
02065   /* create fsal_path_t */  
02066   st = FSAL_str2path( content, 256, &create_arg.link_content );
02067   
02068   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02069     {
02070       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2path:");
02071       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02072       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02073       return st.major;
02074     }
02075     
02076     
02077   if( ( subdir_hdl = cache_inode_create( new_hdl, 
02078                                          &objname, 
02079                                          SYMBOLIC_LINK,
02080                                          fsalmode, 
02081                                          &create_arg,
02082                                          &attrsymlink, 
02083                                          ht, 
02084                                          &context->client,
02085                                          &context->context, 
02086                                          &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
02087     {
02088       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_create(SYMBOLIC_LINK) : %J%r\n",
02089                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
02090       
02091       return context->cache_status ;
02092     }
02093 
02094   if( flag_v )
02095   {
02096     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created (handle=%p) \n",glob_path,file, subdir_hdl ) ;
02097   }
02098 
02099   return 0;  
02100 }
02101 
02102 
02104 int fn_Cache_inode_create( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02105                            char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02106                            FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ )
02107 {
02108   
02109   
02110   static char format[]="hv";
02111    
02112   static char help_create[]=
02113   "usage: create [-h][-v] <path> [mode]\n"
02114   "       path: path of the file to be created\n"
02115   "       mode: octal mode for the directory to be created (ex: 644)\n" ;
02116 
02117   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02118   cache_entry_t * new_hdl ;
02119   cache_entry_t * subdir_hdl ;
02120   fsal_status_t st;
02121   int rc,option;
02122   int flag_v=0;
02123   int flag_h=0;
02124   int err_flag=0;
02125   int mode;
02126   fsal_accessmode_t fsalmode = 0644;
02127   fsal_attrib_list_t attrcreate ;
02128   
02129   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02130   char * path;
02131   char * file;
02132   char * strmode;
02133   
02134   fsal_name_t objname;
02135   
02136   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
02137    
02138   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02139   if( ! cache_init )
02140    {
02141      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
02142      return -1;
02143    }
02144 
02145   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
02146   
02147   /* analysing options */
02148   getopt_init();
02149   while ( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1){   
02150     switch( option )
02151       {
02152       case 'v':
02153         if( flag_v )
02154           fprintf( output, "create: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02155         else flag_v++;
02156         break;
02157         
02158       case 'h':
02159         if( flag_h )
02160           fprintf( output, "create: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02161         else flag_h++;
02162         break;
02163         
02164       case '?':
02165         fprintf( output,"create: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02166         err_flag ++;
02167         break;
02168     }    
02169   }
02170   
02171   if( flag_h )
02172     {
02173       fprintf( output, help_create);
02174       return 0;
02175     }
02176   
02177   /* 1 or 2 args expected */
02178   if ( Optind != (argc-2) && Optind != (argc-1) )
02179   {
02180     err_flag ++;
02181   }
02182   else
02183   {
02184     
02185     strncpy(tmp_path,argv[Optind],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02186     split_path(tmp_path,&path,&file);
02187     
02188       if ( Optind == ( argc - 1 ) )
02189       {
02190         mode = 0755;
02191       }
02192       else
02193       {
02194         strmode = argv[Optind+1];
02195         /* converting mode string to FSAL mode string */
02196         mode = atomode( strmode );  
02197       }
02198           
02199     if (mode<0) err_flag ++;
02200     else {
02201 
02202       fsalmode = 0;
02203 
02204       if ( mode & S_ISUID ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_SUID;
02205       if ( mode & S_ISGID ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_SGID;
02206 
02207       if ( mode & S_IRUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_RUSR;
02208       if ( mode & S_IWUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WUSR;
02209       if ( mode & S_IXUSR ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XUSR;
02210 
02211       if ( mode & S_IRGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_RGRP;
02212       if ( mode & S_IWGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WGRP;
02213       if ( mode & S_IXGRP ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XGRP;
02214 
02215       if ( mode & S_IROTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_ROTH;
02216       if ( mode & S_IWOTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_WOTH;
02217       if ( mode & S_IXOTH ) fsalmode|= FSAL_MODE_XOTH;
02218 
02219     }
02220     
02221   }
02222   
02223   if( err_flag )
02224     {
02225       fprintf( output, help_create );
02226       return -1;
02227     }
02228   
02229   /* copy current path. */
02230   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02231   
02232   /* retrieves path handle*/
02233   if (rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, path, context->pentry, &new_hdl,output) )
02234     return rc;
02235 
02236   /* create fsal_name_t */
02237   st = FSAL_str2name( file, 256,&objname ) ;
02238   
02239   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02240     {
02241       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02242       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02243       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02244       return st.major;
02245     }
02246 
02247   if( ( subdir_hdl = cache_inode_create( new_hdl, 
02248                                          &objname, 
02249                                          REGULAR_FILE,
02250                                          fsalmode, 
02251                                          NULL, 
02252                                          &attrcreate, 
02253                                          ht, 
02254                                          &context->client,
02255                                          &context->context, 
02256                                          &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
02257     {
02258       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_create(DIR_BEGINNING) : %J%r\n",
02259                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
02260       
02261       return context->cache_status ;
02262     }
02263 
02264   if( flag_v )
02265   {
02266     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully created (handle=%p) \n",glob_path,file, subdir_hdl ) ;
02267   }
02268 
02269   return 0;  
02270 }
02271 
02272 
02273 
02275 int fn_Cache_inode_rename( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02276                            char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02277                            FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */)
02278 { 
02279   static char format[]="hv";
02280   
02281   static char help_rename[]=
02282     "usage: rename [-h][-v] <src> <dest>\n";
02283   
02284   char src_glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02285   char tgt_glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02286   
02287   cache_entry_t * src_path_pentry ;
02288   cache_entry_t * tgt_path_pentry ;
02289   fsal_name_t     src_name ;
02290   fsal_name_t     tgt_name ;
02291   
02292   fsal_status_t  st;
02293   int rc,option;
02294   int flag_v=0;
02295   int flag_h=0;
02296   int err_flag=0;
02297   
02298   char tmp_path1[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02299   char tmp_path2[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02300   char * src_path;
02301   char * src_file;
02302   char * tgt_path;
02303   char * tgt_file;
02304   
02305   fsal_attrib_list_t attrsrc ;
02306   fsal_attrib_list_t attrdest ;
02307   
02308     
02309   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
02310    
02311   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02312   if( !cache_init )
02313    {
02314      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
02315      return -1;
02316    }
02317 
02318   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
02319   
02320   /* analysing options */
02321   getopt_init();
02322   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
02323     {   
02324       switch( option )
02325         {
02326         case 'v':
02327           if( flag_v )
02328             fprintf( output, "rename: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n" ) ;
02329           else 
02330             flag_v++ ;
02331         break ;
02332         
02333         case 'h':
02334           if( flag_h )
02335             fprintf( output, "rename: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n" ) ;
02336           else 
02337             flag_h++;
02338           break ;
02339           
02340         case '?':
02341           fprintf(output,"rename: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02342           err_flag ++ ;
02343           break;
02344         }    
02345     }
02346   
02347   if( flag_h )
02348     {
02349       fprintf(output,help_rename);
02350       return 0;
02351     }
02352   
02353   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02354   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
02355     {
02356       err_flag ++;
02357     } 
02358   else 
02359     {
02360       strncpy( tmp_path1, argv[Optind], FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02361       split_path( tmp_path1, &src_path, &src_file );
02362       
02363       strncpy( tmp_path2, argv[Optind+1], FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02364       split_path( tmp_path2, &tgt_path, &tgt_file );
02365     }
02366   
02367   if( err_flag )
02368     {
02369       fprintf(output,help_rename);
02370       return -1;
02371     }
02372   
02373   if( flag_v )
02374     fprintf( output,"Renaming %s (dir %s) to %s (dir %s)\n", src_file, src_path, tgt_file, tgt_path );
02375   
02376   /* copy current path. */
02377   strncpy( src_glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02378   strncpy( tgt_glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02379   
02380   /* retrieves paths handles */
02381   if( rc = cache_solvepath( src_glob_path,
02382                       FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02383                       src_path,
02384                       context->pentry,
02385                       &src_path_pentry,
02386                       output ) )
02387     return rc;
02388 
02389   if( rc = cache_solvepath(tgt_glob_path,
02390                            FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,
02391                            tgt_path,
02392                            context->pentry,
02393                            &tgt_path_pentry,
02394                            output ) )
02395     return rc;
02396   
02397   
02398   /* create fsal_name_t */
02399   
02400   st = FSAL_str2name( src_file, 256,  &src_name );
02401   
02402   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02403     {
02404       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:" );
02405       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02406       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02407       return st.major;
02408     }
02409 
02410   st = FSAL_str2name( tgt_file, 256,  &tgt_name );
02411   
02412   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02413     {
02414       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:" );
02415       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02416       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02417       return st.major;
02418     }
02419 
02420   /* Rename operation */  
02421   if( cache_inode_rename( src_path_pentry, 
02422                           &src_name,      
02423                           tgt_path_pentry,
02424                           &tgt_name,  
02425                           &attrsrc, 
02426                           &attrdest, 
02427                           ht, 
02428                           &context->client, 
02429                           &context->context, 
02430                           &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
02431     {
02432       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_rename : %J%r\n",
02433                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
02434       
02435       return context->cache_status ; 
02436     }
02437 
02438   if( flag_v )
02439     fprintf( output,"%s/%s successfully renamed to %s/%s\n",
02440              src_glob_path, src_file,
02441              tgt_glob_path, tgt_file );
02442       
02443   return 0;
02444 }
02445 
02446 
02448 int fn_Cache_inode_unlink( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02449                            char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02450                            FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ )
02451 {
02452   
02453   
02454   static char format[]="hv";
02455    
02456   static char help_ln[]= "usage: ln [-h][-v] <path>\n" ;
02457 
02458   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02459   cache_entry_t * new_hdl ;
02460   fsal_status_t st;
02461   int rc,option;
02462   int flag_v=0;
02463   int flag_h=0;
02464   int err_flag=0;
02465   
02466   char tmp_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
02467   char * path;
02468   char * file;
02469   
02470   fsal_name_t objname;
02471   fsal_attrib_list_t attrparent ;
02472 
02473   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
02474    
02475   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02476   if( !cache_init ) 
02477    {
02478      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
02479      return -1;
02480    }
02481 
02482   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
02483   
02484   /* analysing options */
02485   getopt_init();
02486   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
02487     {   
02488       switch( option )
02489         {
02490         case 'v':
02491           if( flag_v )
02492             fprintf( output, "unlink: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02493           else flag_v++;
02494           break;
02495           
02496         case 'h':
02497           if( flag_h )
02498             fprintf( output, "unlink: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02499           else flag_h++;
