02500           break;
02501           
02502         case '?':
02503           fprintf( output,"unlink: unknown option : %c\n", Optopt);
02504           err_flag ++;
02505         break;
02506         }    
02507     }
02508   
02509   if( flag_h )
02510     {
02511       fprintf( output, help_ln);
02512       return 0;
02513     }
02514   
02515   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02516   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) )
02517     {
02518       err_flag ++;
02519     } 
02520   else 
02521     {
02522       strncpy( tmp_path, argv[Optind], FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02523       split_path( tmp_path, &path, &file);
02524       
02525     }
02526   
02527   if( err_flag )
02528     {
02529       fprintf( output, help_ln );
02530       return -1;
02531     }
02532   
02533   /* copy current path. */
02534   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN );
02535   
02536   /* retrieves path handle*/
02537   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, path, context->pentry, &new_hdl,output) )
02538     return rc;
02539 
02540   /* create fsal_name_t */
02541   st = FSAL_str2name( file, 256,&objname ) ;
02542   
02543   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02544     {
02545       fprintf( output, "Error executing FSAL_str2name:");
02546       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02547       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02548       return st.major;
02549     }
02550 
02551   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
02552     {
02553       fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2path:");
02554       print_fsal_status( output, st );
02555       fprintf( output, "\n" );
02556       return st.major;
02557     }
02558 
02559   cache_inode_remove( new_hdl, 
02560                       &objname, 
02561                       &attrparent, 
02562                       ht, 
02563                       &context->client,
02564                       &context->context, 
02565                       &context->cache_status ) ;
02566   if( context->cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
02567     {
02568       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_remove : %J%r\n",
02569                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );      
02570       return context->cache_status ;
02571     }
02572   
02573   if( flag_v )
02574   {
02575     fprintf(output,"%s/%s successfully unlinked\n",glob_path,file ) ;
02576   }
02577 
02578   return 0;
02579 }
02580 
02581 
02588 int fn_Cache_inode_setattr( int     argc ,     /* IN : number of args in argv */
02589                             char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02590                             FILE *  output     /* IN : output stream          */ )
02591 {
02592   
02593   static char format[]="hv";
02594    
02595   static char help_setattr[]=
02596     "usage: setattr [-h][-v] <path> <attr>=<value>,<attr>=<value>,...\n";
02597 
02598   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
02599 
02600   cache_entry_t        * obj_hdl ;        /* handle of the object    */
02601   fsal_attrib_list_t     set_attrs;       /* attributes to be setted */
02602   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status;    /* FSAL return status      */
02603   
02604   int rc, option;
02605   int flag_v=0;
02606   int flag_h=0;
02607   int err_flag=0;
02608   
02609   char file[FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN];        /* the relative path to the object */
02610   char * attr_list  = NULL;               /* attribute name */
02611        
02612   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
02613    
02614   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02615   if ( !cache_init )
02616    {
02617      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
02618      return -1;
02619    }
02620 
02621   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
02622     
02623   /* analysing options */
02624   getopt_init() ;
02625   
02626   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format )) != -1 )
02627   {   
02628     switch( option )
02629       {
02630       case 'v':
02631         if( flag_v )
02632           fprintf( output, "setattr: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02633         else 
02634           flag_v++;
02635         break;
02636         
02637       case 'h':
02638         if( flag_h )
02639           fprintf(output, "setattr: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02640         else 
02641           flag_h++;
02642         break;
02643         
02644       case '?':
02645         fprintf(output,"setattr: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02646         err_flag ++;
02647         break;
02648     }    
02649   }
02650   
02651   if( flag_h )
02652     {
02653     
02654       shell_attribute_t * curr_attr;
02655       
02656       /* print usage */
02657       fprintf(output,help_setattr);
02658       
02659       fprintf(output,"\n<attr> can be one of the following values:\n");
02660       
02661       /* print attribute list */
02662       
02663       for( curr_attr = shell_attr_list; curr_attr->attr_type != ATTR_NONE; curr_attr++ )
02664         {
02665           switch( curr_attr->attr_type)
02666             {              
02667             case ATTR_32:        
02668               fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t 32 bits integer\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
02669               break;
02670               
02671             case ATTR_64:
02672               fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t 64 bits integer\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
02673               break;
02674               
02675             case ATTR_OCTAL:
02676               fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t octal\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
02677               break;
02678               
02679             case ATTR_TIME:
02680               fprintf( output, "\t %s \t:\t time (format: YYYYMMDDhhmmss)\n",curr_attr->attr_name );
02681               break;
02682             }
02683         }    
02684       
02685       return 0;
02686     }
02687   
02688   /* Exactly 2 args expected (path and attributes list)*/
02689   
02690   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) )
02691     {
02692       err_flag ++;
02693     } 
02694   else 
02695     {
02696       strcpy( file,  argv[Optind] ) ;
02697       attr_list = argv[Optind+1] ;
02698     }
02699   
02700   if( err_flag )
02701     {
02702       fprintf( output, help_setattr );
02703       return -1;
02704     }
02705   
02706   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
02707   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02708   
02709   /* retrieve handle to the file whose attributes are to be changed */
02710   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
02711     return rc ;
02712     
02713   /* Convert the peer (attr_name,attr_val) to an FSAL attribute structure. */
02714   rc = MkFSALSetAttrStruct( attr_list, &set_attrs );
02715   
02716   /* interprets output code */
02717   switch( rc )
02718     {
02719     case 0:
02720       /* OK */
02721       break;
02722       
02723     case EFAULT:
02724       fprintf(output,"setattr: Internal error.\n");
02725       return rc;
02726       
02727     case ENOENT:
02728       fprintf(output,"setattr: Unknown attribute in list %s\n", attr_list);
02729       return rc;
02730       
02731     case EINVAL:
02732       fprintf(output,"setattr: Invalid value for attribute in list %s\n", attr_list );
02733       return rc;
02734       
02735     default:
02736       fprintf(output,"setattr: Error %d converting attributes.\n",rc );
02737       return rc;
02738     }
02739   
02740   /* if verbose mode is on, we print the attributes to be set */    
02741   if( flag_v )
02742     {
02743       print_fsal_attributes( set_attrs, output );
02744     }
02745   
02746   
02747   /* executes set attrs */
02748   if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_setattr( obj_hdl, 
02749                                             &set_attrs,
02750                                             ht,
02751                                             &context->client, 
02752                                             &context->context, 
02753                                             &context->cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
02754                                             
02755     {
02756       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_setattr : %J%r\n",
02757                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
02758       return context->cache_status ;
02759     }
02760   
02761   return 0;  
02762 }
02763 
02764 
02765 
02772 int fn_Cache_inode_access(  int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02773                             char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02774                             FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ )
02775 {
02776   
02777   static char format[]="hv";
02778    
02779   static char help_access[]=
02780     "usage: access [-h][-v] <rights> <path>\n"
02781     "\n"
02782     "   -h : print this help\n"
02783     "   -v : verbose mode\n"
02784     "   -A : test access from attributes\n"
02785     "        ( call to getattr + test_access instead of access )\n"
02786     "\n"
02787     " <rights> : a set of the following characters:\n"
02788     "    F: test file existence\n"
02789     "    R: test read permission\n"
02790     "    W: test write permission\n"
02791     "    X: test execute permission\n"
02792     "\n"
02793     "Example: access -A RX my_dir\n"
02794     "test read and exec rights for directory \"my_dir\"\n"
02795     "by doing a getattr and a test_access call.\n\n";
02796   
02797 
02798   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
02799   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
02800   fsal_accessflags_t  test_perms;     /* permissions to be tested    */
02801   
02802   int rc, option;
02803   unsigned int i;
02804   int flag_v=0;
02805   int flag_h=0;
02806   int err_flag=0;
02807   
02808   char * file = NULL;      /* the relative path to the object */  
02809   char * str_perms = NULL; /* string that represents the permissions to be tested */
02810       
02811   
02812   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
02813    
02814   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02815   if ( !cache_init )
02816    {
02817      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
02818      return -1;
02819    }
02820 
02821   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
02822 
02823     
02824   /* analysing options */
02825   
02826   getopt_init();
02827   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
02828   {   
02829     switch( option )
02830       {
02831       case 'v':
02832         if( flag_v )
02833           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02834         else 
02835           flag_v++;
02836         break;
02837         
02838       case 'h':
02839         if( flag_h )
02840           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02841         else 
02842           flag_h++;
02843         break;
02844         
02845       default:
02846       case '?':
02847         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
02848         err_flag ++;
02849         break;
02850     }    
02851   }
02852   
02853   if( flag_h )
02854     {
02855       /* print usage */
02856       fprintf(output,help_access);    
02857       return 0;
02858     }
02859   
02860   /* Exactly 2 args expected */
02861   if( Optind != ( argc -2 ) ) 
02862     {
02863       err_flag ++;
02864     } 
02865   else 
02866     {
02867       str_perms = argv[Optind];
02868       file = argv[Optind+1];
02869     }
02870   
02871   if( err_flag )
02872     {
02873       fprintf( output, help_access );
02874       return -1;
02875     }
02876     
02877   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
02878   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
02879   
02880   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
02881   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
02882     return rc ; 
02883   
02884   /* Convert the permission string to an fsal access test. */
02885   test_perms = 0;
02886   
02887   for( i=0; i < strlen( str_perms ); i++ )
02888     {    
02889       switch( str_perms[i] )
02890         {
02891         case 'F':        
02892           if( flag_v ) 
02893             fprintf( output, "F_OK flag\n" );
02894           test_perms |= FSAL_F_OK ;
02895         break;
02896         
02897       case 'R':
02898         if( flag_v ) 
02899           fprintf( output, "R_OK flag\n" );
02900         test_perms |= FSAL_R_OK ;
02901         break;
02902         
02903       case 'W':
02904         if( flag_v ) 
02905           fprintf( output, "W_OK flag\n" );
02906         test_perms |= FSAL_W_OK ;
02907         break;
02908         
02909       case 'X':      
02910         if( flag_v )
02911           fprintf( output, "X_OK flag\n" );
02912         test_perms |= FSAL_X_OK ;
02913         break;
02914         
02915         default:
02916           fprintf( output, "**** Invalid test: %c ****\n", str_perms[i] );
02917         fprintf( output, help_access );
02918         return -1;
02919         }    
02920     }  
02921   
02922   /* Call to FSAL */
02923   
02924   if( ( context->cache_status = cache_inode_access( obj_hdl, 
02925                                            test_perms, 
02926                                            ht, 
02927                                            &context->client, 
02928                                            &context->context, 
02929                                            &context->cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
02930     {
02931       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_access : %J%r\n",
02932                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
02933       return context->cache_status ;
02934     }
02935   else 
02936     {  
02937       fprintf(output,"access: Access granted.\n");
02938       return 0;   
02939     }
02940 }
02941 
02942 
02944 int fn_Cache_inode_data_cache( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
02945                                   char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
02946                                   FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
02947 {
02948   static char format[]="hv";
02949    
02950   static char help_data_cache[]=
02951     "usage: data_cache [-h][-v]  <path>\n"
02952     "\n"
02953     "   -h : print this help\n"
02954     "   -v : verbose mode\n" ;
02955   
02956 
02957   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
02958   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
02959   
02960   int rc,option;
02961   int flag_v=0;
02962   int flag_h=0;
02963   int err_flag=0;
02964   
02965   char * file = NULL; /* the relative path to the object */  
02966       
02967 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
02968   fsal_name_t name ;
02969 #endif
02970   
02971   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
02972    
02973   /* is the fs initialized ? */
02974   if( !cache_init )
02975    {
02976      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
02977      return -1;
02978    }
02979 
02980   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
02981   
02982   /* analysing options */
02983   
02984   getopt_init();
02985   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
02986   {   
02987     switch( option )
02988       {
02989       case 'v':
02990         if( flag_v )
02991           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
02992         else 
02993           flag_v++;
02994         break;
02995         
02996       case 'h':
02997         if( flag_h )
02998           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
02999         else 
03000           flag_h++;
03001         break;
03002         
03003       default:
03004       case '?':
03005         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03006         err_flag ++;
03007         break;
03008     }    
03009   }
03010   
03011   if( flag_h )
03012     {
03013       /* print usage */
03014       fprintf( output, help_data_cache );    
03015       return 0;
03016     }
03017   
03018   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03019   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) ) 
03020     {
03021       err_flag ++;
03022     } 
03023   else 
03024     {
03025       file = argv[Optind];
03026     }
03027   
03028   if( err_flag )
03029     {
03030       fprintf( output, help_data_cache );
03031       return -1;
03032     }
03033     
03034   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03035   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03036 
03037  
03038   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
03039   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
03040     return rc ; 
03041 
03042 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
03043   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( FSAL_str2name( file, MAXPATHLEN, &name) ) )
03044    {
03045       context->cache_status = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR ;
03046       log_fprintf( output, "Error opening file during cache_inode_add_cache : %J%r\n",
03047                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
03048       return context->cache_status ;
03049 
03050    }
03051 
03052   if( cache_inode_open_by_name( context->pentry,
03053                                 &name, 
03054                                 obj_hdl, 
03055                                 &context->client,
03056                                 FSAL_O_RDWR, 
03057                                 &context->context,
03058                                 &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
03059     {
03060       log_fprintf( output, "Error opening file during cache_inode_add_cache : %J%r\n",
03061                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
03062       return context->cache_status ;
03063     }
03064  
03065 #endif 
03066 
03067 
03068   if( flag_v )
03069     printf( "---> data_cache using pentry_inode = %p\n", obj_hdl ) ;
03070   
03071   if( cache_inode_add_data_cache( obj_hdl, ht, &context->client, &context->context,
03072       &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
03073     {
03074       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_add_cache : %J%r\n",
03075                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
03076       return context->cache_status ;
03077     }
03078   
03079   if( flag_v )
03080     {
03081       fprintf( output, "Entry %p is now boud to datacache entry %p\n", obj_hdl, obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content ) ;
03082     }
03083 
03084   return 0 ;
03085 } /* fn_Cache_inode_data_cache */
03086 
03087 
03089 int fn_Cache_inode_release_cache( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03090                                   char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03091                                   FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
03092 {
03093   static char format[]="hv";
03094   
03095   static char help_release_cache[]=
03096     "usage: release_cache [-h][-v]  <path>\n"
03097     "\n"
03098     "   -h : print this help\n"
03099     "   -v : verbose mode\n" ;
03100   
03101   
03102   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
03103   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
03104   
03105   int rc,option;
03106   int flag_v=0;
03107   int flag_h=0;
03108   int err_flag=0;
03109   
03110   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
03111       
03112   
03113   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
03114    
03115   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03116   if( !cache_init )
03117    {
03118      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
03119      return -1;
03120    }
03121 
03122   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
03123   
03124   /* analysing options */
03125   
03126   getopt_init();
03127   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
03128   {   
03129     switch( option )
03130       {
03131       case 'v':
03132         if( flag_v )
03133           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03134         else 
03135           flag_v++;
03136         break;
03137         
03138       case 'h':
03139         if( flag_h )
03140           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03141         else 
03142           flag_h++;
03143         break;
03144         
03145       default:
03146       case '?':
03147         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03148         err_flag ++;
03149         break;
03150     }    
03151   }
03152   
03153   if( flag_h )
03154     {
03155       /* print usage */
03156       fprintf( output, help_release_cache );    
03157       return 0;
03158     }
03159   
03160   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03161   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) ) 
03162     {
03163       err_flag ++;
03164     } 
03165   else 
03166     {
03167       file = argv[Optind];
03168     }
03169   
03170   if( err_flag )
03171     { 
03172       fprintf( output, help_release_cache );
03173       return -1;
03174     }
03175     
03176   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03177   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03178   
03179   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
03180   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
03181     return rc ; 
03182 
03183   if( cache_inode_release_data_cache( obj_hdl, ht, &context->client, &context->context, &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
03184     {
03185       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_release_cache : %J%r\n",
03186                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
03187       return context->cache_status ;
03188     }
03189   
03190   if( flag_v )
03191     {
03192       fprintf( output, "Entry %p is no more bounded to datacache\n", obj_hdl ) ;
03193     }
03194 
03195   return 0 ;
03196 } /* fn_Cache_inode_release_cache */

03198 
03200 int fn_Cache_inode_recover_cache( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03201                                   char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03202                                   FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
03203 {
03204   static char format[]="hv";
03205   
03206   static char help_recover_cache[]=
03207     "usage: recover_cache [-h][-v]  <path>\n"
03208     "\n"
03209     "   -h : print this help\n"
03210     "   -v : verbose mode\n" ;
03211   
03212   
03213   cache_content_status_t cache_content_status ;
03214   
03215   int option;
03216   int flag_v=0;
03217   int flag_h=0;
03218   int err_flag=0;
03219   
03220   
03221   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
03222    
03223   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03224   if( !cache_init )
03225    {
03226      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
03227      return -1;
03228    }
03229 
03230   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
03231   
03232   /* analysing options */
03233   
03234   getopt_init();
03235   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
03236   {   
03237     switch( option )
03238       {
03239       case 'v':
03240         if( flag_v )
03241           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03242         else 
03243           flag_v++;
03244         break;
03245         
03246       case 'h':
03247         if( flag_h )
03248           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03249         else 
03250           flag_h++;
03251         break;
03252         
03253       default:
03254       case '?':
03255         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03256         err_flag ++;
03257         break;
03258     }    
03259   }
03260   
03261   if( flag_h )
03262     {
03263       /* print usage */
03264       fprintf( output, help_recover_cache );    
03265       return 0;
03266     }
03267   
03268   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03269   if( Optind != argc ) 
03270     {
03271       err_flag ++;
03272     } 
03273   
03274   if( err_flag )
03275     { 
03276       fprintf( output, help_recover_cache );
03277       return -1;
03278     }
03279     
03280 
03281   if( cache_content_crash_recover( EXPORT_ID, 
03282                                    0,
03283                                    1,
03284                                    (cache_content_client_t *)context->client.pcontent_client, 
03285                                    &context->client,
03286                                    ht,
03287                                    &context->context, 
03288                                    &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
03289     {
03290       fprintf(output,"Error executing cache_content_crash_recover: %d\n", cache_content_status );
03291       return cache_content_status ;
03292     }
03293   
03294   if( flag_v )
03295     {
03296       fprintf( output, "Data cache has been recovered\n" ) ;
03297     }
03298 
03299   return 0 ;
03300 } /* fn_Cache_inode_recover_cache */
03301 
03302 
03304 int fn_Cache_inode_refresh_cache( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03305                                   char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03306                                   FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
03307 {
03308   static char format[]="hv";
03309   
03310   static char help_refresh_cache[]=
03311     "usage: refresh_cache [-h][-v]  <path>\n"
03312     "\n"
03313     "   -h : print this help\n"
03314     "   -v : verbose mode\n" ;
03315   
03316   
03317   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
03318   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
03319   cache_content_status_t cache_content_status ;
03320   
03321   int rc,option;
03322   int flag_v=0;
03323   int flag_h=0;
03324   int err_flag=0;
03325   
03326   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
03327       
03328   
03329   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
03330    
03331   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03332   if( !cache_init )
03333    {
03334      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
03335      return -1;
03336    }
03337 
03338   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
03339   
03340   /* analysing options */
03341   
03342   getopt_init();
03343   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
03344   {   
03345     switch( option )
03346       {
03347       case 'v':
03348         if( flag_v )
03349           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03350         else 
03351           flag_v++;
03352         break;
03353         
03354       case 'h':
03355         if( flag_h )
03356           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03357         else 
03358           flag_h++;
03359         break;
03360         
03361       default:
03362       case '?':
03363         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03364         err_flag ++;
03365         break;
03366     }    
03367   }
03368   
03369   if( flag_h )
03370     {
03371       /* print usage */
03372       fprintf( output, help_refresh_cache );    
03373       return 0;
03374     }
03375   
03376   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03377   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) ) 
03378     {
03379       err_flag ++;
03380     } 
03381   else 
03382     {
03383       file = argv[Optind];
03384     }
03385   
03386   if( err_flag )
03387     { 
03388       fprintf( output, help_refresh_cache );
03389       return -1;
03390     }
03391     
03392   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03393   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03394   
03395   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
03396   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
03397     return rc ; 
03398 
03399   if( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
03400     {
03401       fprintf( output, "Error: this entry is not data cached\n" ) ;
03402       return 1 ;
03403     }
03404 
03405   if( cache_content_refresh( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content, 
03406                              (cache_content_client_t *)context->client.pcontent_client, 
03407                              &context->context, 
03408                              FORCE_FROM_FSAL,
03409                              &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
03410     {
03411       fprintf(output,"Error executing cache_content_refresh: %d\n", cache_content_status );
03412       return cache_content_status ;
03413     }
03414   
03415   if( flag_v )
03416     {
03417       fprintf( output, "Entry %p has been refreshed\n", obj_hdl ) ;
03418     }
03419 
03420   return 0 ;
03421 } /* fn_Cache_inode_refresh_cache */
03422 
03423 
03425 int fn_Cache_inode_flush_cache( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03426                                   char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03427                                   FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
03428 {
03429   static char format[]="hv";
03430   
03431   static char help_flush_cache[]=
03432     "usage: flush_cache [-h][-v]  <path>\n"
03433     "\n"
03434     "   -h : print this help\n"
03435     "   -v : verbose mode\n" ;
03436   
03437   
03438   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
03439   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
03440   cache_content_status_t cache_content_status ;
03441   
03442   int rc,option;
03443   int flag_v=0;
03444   int flag_h=0;
03445   int err_flag=0;
03446   
03447   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
03448       
03449   
03450   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
03451    
03452   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03453   if( !cache_init )
03454    {
03455      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
03456      return -1;
03457    }
03458 
03459   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
03460   
03461   /* analysing options */
03462   
03463   getopt_init();
03464   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
03465   {   
03466     switch( option )
03467       {
03468       case 'v':
03469         if( flag_v )
03470           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03471         else 
03472           flag_v++;
03473         break;
03474         
03475       case 'h':
03476         if( flag_h )
03477           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03478         else 
03479           flag_h++;
03480         break;
03481         
03482       default:
03483       case '?':
03484         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03485         err_flag ++;
03486         break;
03487     }    
03488   }
03489   
03490   if( flag_h )
03491     {
03492       /* print usage */
03493       fprintf( output, help_flush_cache );    
03494       return 0;
03495     }
03496   
03497   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03498   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) ) 
03499     {
03500       err_flag ++;
03501     } 
03502   else 
03503     {
03504       file = argv[Optind];
03505     }
03506   
03507   if( err_flag )
03508     { 
03509       fprintf( output, help_flush_cache );
03510       return -1;
03511     }
03512     
03513   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03514   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03515   
03516   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
03517   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
03518     return rc ; 
03519 
03520   if( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
03521     {
03522       fprintf( output, "Error: this entry is not data cached\n" ) ;
03523       return 1 ;
03524     }
03525 
03526   if( cache_content_flush( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content, 
03527                            CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE,
03528                            (cache_content_client_t *)context->client.pcontent_client, 
03529                            &context->context, 
03530                            &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
03531     {
03532       fprintf(output,"Error executing cache_content_flush: %d\n", cache_content_status );
03533       return cache_content_status ;
03534     }
03535   
03536   if( flag_v )
03537     {
03538       fprintf( output, "Entry %p has been flushed\n", obj_hdl ) ;
03539     }
03540 
03541   return 0 ;
03542 } /* fn_Cache_inode_flush_cache */
03543 
03545 int fn_Cache_inode_read( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03546                          char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03547                          FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
03548 {
03549   static char format[]="hvAXB:s:";
03550   int rc,option;
03551 
03552   int err_flag=0 ;
03553   int flag_v=0;
03554   int flag_h=0;
03555   int flag_s=0;
03556   int flag_A=0;
03557   int flag_X=0;
03558   int flag_B=0;
03559   
03560   fsal_attrib_list_t         fsal_attr ;
03561   
03562   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
03563   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
03564 
03565   char   str_seek_buff[256];      
03566   char * str_seek_type = NULL;
03567   char * str_seek_offset = NULL;  
03568   char * str_total_bytes = NULL;
03569   char * str_block_size = NULL;
03570 
03571   fsal_size_t block_size = 1024;  /* default: 1ko */  
03572   fsal_size_t total_bytes = 0; /* 0 == read all */
03573   fsal_seek_t seek_desc =
03574   { FSAL_SEEK_SET, 0 }; /* default: start of the file */
03575   
03576   /* fsal arguments */
03577   
03578   fsal_boolean_t  is_eof = 0;
03579   fsal_size_t     total_nb_read = 0;
03580   fsal_size_t     once_nb_read = 0;
03581   fsal_size_t     nb_block_read = 0;
03582 
03583   char * p_read_buff;
03584   
03585   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
03586   
03587   struct timeval timer_start;
03588   struct timeval timer_stop;
03589   struct timeval timer_diff;
03590 
03591   static char help_read[]=
03592     "Usage:\n"
03593     "  read [-h][-v][-A][-X] [-B <block_size> ] [ -s <seek_type>,<offset> ]  { <total_bytes> | all } filename\n"
03594     "Options:\n"
03595     "  -h: print this help\n"
03596     "  -v: verbose mode\n"
03597     "  -A: display read data in ascii\n"
03598     "  -X: display read data in hexa\n"
03599     "  -B <blocksize>: block size used for reading, in bytes (default 1k).\n"
03600     "  -s <seek_type>,<offset>: specify the position of the first byte to be read.\n"
03601     "        <seek_type> can take the values SET, CUR or END.\n"
03602     "        <offset> is a signed integer.\n"
03603     "  <total_bytes>: indicates the total number of bytes to be read\n"
03604     "      ('all' indicates that data are read until the end of the file).\n"
03605     "Example:\n"
03606     "  For reading the last 2kB of the opened file, using 1k block size:\n"
03607     "        read -B 1024 -s END,-2048 all  filename\n";
03608   
03609   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
03610    
03611   /* is the fs initialized ? */
03612   if( !cache_init )
03613    {
03614      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
03615      return -1;
03616    }
03617 
03618   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
03619   
03620   /* analysing options */
03621   getopt_init();
03622 
03623   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
03624     {
03625       switch( option )
03626         {
03627         case 'v':
03628           if (flag_v)
03629             fprintf(output,
03630                     "read: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
03631           else
03632             flag_v++;
03633           break;
03634           
03635       case 'h':
03636         if ( flag_h )
03637           fprintf(output,
03638                   "read: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
03639         else 
03640           flag_h++;
03641         break;
03642         
03643         case 'A':
03644           if ( flag_A )
03645             fprintf(output,
03646                     "read: warning: option 'A' has been specified more than once.\n");
03647           else if ( flag_X )
03648             {
03649               fprintf(output,
03650                       "read: option 'A' conflicts with option 'X'.\n");
03651               err_flag ++;
03652             }
03653           else 
03654             flag_A++;
03655           break;
03656           
03657         case 'X':
03658           if ( flag_X )
03659             fprintf(output,
03660                     "read: warning: option 'X' has been specified more than once.\n");
03661           else if ( flag_A )
03662             {
03663               fprintf(output,
03664                       "read: option 'X' conflicts with option 'A'.\n");
03665               err_flag ++;
03666             }
03667           else 
03668             flag_X++;
03669           break;
03670           
03671         case 'B':
03672           if ( flag_B )
03673             fprintf(output,
03674                     "read: warning: option 'B' has been specified more than once.\n");
03675           else
03676             {
03677               flag_B++;
03678               str_block_size = Optarg;
03679             }
03680           break;
03681           
03682         case 's':
03683           if ( flag_s )
03684             fprintf(output,
03685                     "read: warning: option 's' has been specified more than once.\n");
03686           else
03687             {
03688               flag_s++;
03689               strncpy(str_seek_buff,Optarg,256);
03690               str_seek_type = str_seek_buff;
03691             }
03692           break;
03693           
03694         case '?':
03695           fprintf(output,"read: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
03696           err_flag ++;
03697           break;
03698         }    
03699     }
03700   
03701   if( flag_h )
03702     {
03703       /* print usage */
03704       fprintf( output, help_read );    
03705       return 0;
03706     }
03707   
03708   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
03709   if( Optind != ( argc - 2 ) ) 
03710     {
03711       err_flag ++;
03712     } 
03713   else 
03714     {
03715       str_total_bytes = argv[Optind] ;
03716       file = argv[Optind+1];
03717     }
03718   
03719   if( err_flag )
03720     { 
03721       fprintf( output, help_read ) ;
03722       return -1;
03723     }
03724     
03725   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
03726   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
03727   
03728   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
03729   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
03730     return rc ; 
03731 
03732   /* Sanity check */
03733   if( obj_hdl->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
03734     {
03735       fprintf( output, "Error: This entry is no REGULAR_FILE\n" ) ;
03736       return 1 ;
03737     }
03738   
03739   /* Is this entry cached ? */
03740   if( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
03741     {
03742       if( flag_v )
03743         fprintf( output, "Warning: This entry is not data cached\n" )  ;
03744     }
03745   
03746   /* check argument types */
03747     
03748   if( flag_B )
03749   {
03750     /* Try to convert the str_block_size to fsal_size_t */
03751     
03752     rc = ato64( str_block_size, &block_size );
03753     
03754     if ( rc == -1 )
03755       {
03756         fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid block size \"%s\"\n",
03757                 str_block_size);
03758         err_flag++;
03759       }
03760     
03761   }
03762   
03763   if( flag_s )
03764   {
03765     /* Try to parse the argument */
03766     
03767     str_seek_offset = strchr( str_seek_type, ',' );
03768     
03769     if ( str_seek_offset == NULL )
03770       {
03771         fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid seek specifier \"%s\". <seek_type>,<offset> expected.\n",
03772                 str_seek_type);
03773         err_flag++;      
03774       }
03775     
03776     if ( !err_flag )
03777       {
03778         int sign = 1;
03779         
03780         *str_seek_offset='\0';
03781         str_seek_offset++; /* the first char after the "," */
03782         
03783         /* Check seek type */
03784         
03785         if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "CUR", 256 ) )
03786           seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_CUR;
03787         else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "SET", 256 ) )
03788           seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET;
03789         else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "END", 256 ) )
03790           seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_END;
03791         else
03792           {
03793             fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid seek type \"%s\". CUR, SET or END expected.\n",
03794                     str_seek_type);
03795             err_flag ++;
03796           }
03797         
03798         /* Try to convert str_seek_offset to fsal_off_t */
03799         
03800         switch (str_seek_offset[0])
03801           {
03802           case '+':
03803             sign = 1;
03804             str_seek_offset ++;
03805             break;
03806              
03807           case '-':
03808             sign = -1;
03809             str_seek_offset ++;
03810             break;
03811           }
03812         
03813         rc = ato64( str_seek_offset, (unsigned long long *)&seek_desc.offset );
03814         
03815         if ( rc == -1 )
03816           {
03817             fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid offset \"%s\".\n",
03818                     str_seek_offset);
03819             err_flag++;
03820           }
03821         else
03822           if (sign < 0) seek_desc.offset = -seek_desc.offset;
03823         
03824       }
03825     
03826   }
03827   /* else default seeking : SET,0 */
03828   
03829   
03830   if (!strcasecmp( str_total_bytes , "all" ))
03831     {
03832     total_bytes = 0;
03833     }
03834   else
03835     {
03836       rc = ato64( str_total_bytes, &total_bytes );
03837       
03838       if ( rc == -1 )
03839         {
03840           fprintf(output,"read: error: invalid read size \"%s\". \"all\" or <nb_bytes> expected.\n",
03841                   str_total_bytes);
03842           err_flag++;
03843         }
03844     }
03845   
03846   if (err_flag)
03847     {
03848       fprintf(output,help_read);
03849       return -1;
03850     }
03851   
03852   if (flag_v)
03853     {
03854       /* print a sum-up of read parameters */
03855       fprintf(output, "Read options: Block size: %llu Bytes, Seek: %s%+lld, Read limit: %llu Bytes\n",
03856               block_size,
03857               ( seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_SET ? "SET":
03858                 seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_CUR ? "CUR":
03859                 "END" ),
03860               (long long)seek_desc.offset,
03861               total_bytes );
03862     }
03863   
03864   
03865   /* Now all arguments have been parsed, let's act ! */
03866   
03867   /* alloc a buffer */
03868   p_read_buff = Mem_Alloc( block_size );
03869   
03870   if ( p_read_buff == NULL )
03871     {
03872       fprintf(output,"read: error: Not enough memory to allocate read buffer (%llu Bytes).\n",block_size);
03873       return ENOMEM;    
03874     }
03875   
03876   
03877   gettimeofday( &timer_start,NULL );  
03878   
03879   /* while EOF is not reached, and read<asked (when total_bytes!=0) */
03880   while ( !is_eof && !( ( total_bytes!= 0) && (total_nb_read >= total_bytes) ) )
03881     {
03882       if( cache_inode_rdwr( obj_hdl, 
03883                             CACHE_INODE_READ,
03884                             &seek_desc, 
03885                             block_size, 
03886                             &once_nb_read, 
03887                             &fsal_attr,
03888                             (caddr_t)p_read_buff, 
03889                             &is_eof,
03890                             ht, 
03891                             &context->client, 
03892                             &context->context, 
03893                             &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
03894       {
03895         log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_read : %J%r\n",
03896                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
03897 
03898         return context->cache_status ;
03899       }
03900 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
03901       DisplayLogFlux( output,
03902                       "shell: block_size=%llu, once_nb_read=%llu, total_bytes=%llu, total_nb_read=%llu, eof=%d, seek=%d.%llu", 
03903                       block_size, once_nb_read, total_bytes, total_nb_read, is_eof,
03904                       seek_desc.whence, seek_desc.offset ) ;
03905 #endif
03906       
03907       /* print what was read. */
03908       if ( flag_A )
03909         {
03910           fsal_size_t index;
03911           for (index=0; index<once_nb_read; index ++)
03912             fprintf( output, "%c.", p_read_buff[index] );
03913         }
03914       else if ( flag_X )
03915         {
03916           fsal_size_t index;
03917           for (index=0; index<once_nb_read; index ++)
03918             fprintf( output, "%.2X ", p_read_buff[index] );      
03919         }
03920       else
03921         fprintf( output,"." );
03922       
03923       /* update stats */    
03924       
03925       if (once_nb_read>0) nb_block_read ++;
03926       
03927       total_nb_read += once_nb_read;
03928       
03929       /* flush */
03930       if( nb_block_read % 10 ) 
03931         fflush( output );
03932       
03933       /* Update the seek descriptor */
03934       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
03935       seek_desc.offset += once_nb_read ;
03936       
03937     }
03938   
03939   gettimeofday( &timer_stop,NULL );
03940   
03941   /* newline after read blocks */
03942   fprintf( output,"\n" );  
03943   
03944   if( flag_v )
03945     {
03946       double bandwidth ;
03947       
03948       /* print stats */
03949       fprintf(output, "Nb blocks read: %llu\n", nb_block_read);
03950       fprintf(output, "Total: %llu Bytes\n", total_nb_read );
03951       
03952       fprintf(output, "Time enlapsed: ");
03953       timer_diff = time_diff( timer_start, timer_stop );
03954       print_timeval( output, timer_diff );
03955       
03956       bandwidth = total_nb_read/(1024*1024*( timer_diff.tv_sec + 0.000001 * timer_diff.tv_usec ));
03957       
03958       fprintf(output, "Bandwidth: %f MB/s\n", bandwidth );
03959       
03960     }
03961   Mem_Free(p_read_buff);
03962   
03963   return 0;
03964 } /* fn_Cache_inode_read */
03965 
03966 
03968 int fn_Cache_inode_write( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
03969                          char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
03970                           FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
03971 {
03972   static char format[]="hvs:N:A:X:";
03973 
03974   int rc,option;
03975   int err_flag=0 ;
03976 
03977   int flag_v=0;
03978   int flag_h=0;
03979   int flag_N=0;
03980   int flag_s=0;
03981   int flag_A=0;
03982   int flag_X=0;
03983 
03984   char * str_times = NULL;
03985   char str_seek_buff[256];      
03986   char * str_seek_type = NULL;
03987   char * str_seek_offset = NULL;  
03988   
03989   char * str_hexa = NULL;  
03990   char * str_ascii = NULL;
03991   
03992   size_t datasize = 0;
03993   char * databuff = NULL;
03994 
03995   unsigned long long nb_times=1; /* default = 1 */  
03996   fsal_u64_t  nb_block_written=0;
03997   fsal_size_t size_written=0;
03998   fsal_size_t size_written_once=0;
03999 
04000   fsal_size_t block_size = 1024;  /* default: 1ko */  
04001   fsal_seek_t seek_desc =
04002   { FSAL_SEEK_SET, 0 }; /* default: start of the file */
04003  
04004   fsal_attrib_list_t         fsal_attr ;
04005 
04006   fsal_boolean_t fsal_eof ;
04007   
04008   struct timeval timer_start;
04009   struct timeval timer_stop;
04010   struct timeval timer_diff;
04011   
04012     
04013   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
04014   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
04015   
04016   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
04017       
04018   static char help_write[]=
04019     "Usage:\n"
04020     "  write [-h][-v] [ -s <seek_type>,<offset> ]  [-N <nb_times>] -A <ascii_string> filename\n"
04021     "  write [-h][-v] [ -s <seek_type>,<offset> ]  [-N <nb_times>] -X <hexa_data> filename\n"
04022     "Where:\n"
04023     "  <seek_type> can be: SET, CUR, END\n"
04024     "  <offset> is a signed number of bytes.\n"
04025     "  <nb_times> is the number of times we write the expression into the file.\n"
04026     "\n"
04027     "  <ascii_string> is a string to be written to file.\n"
04028     "      Note that the null terminating character of is also written\n"
04029     "      to file.\n"
04030     "or\n"
04031     "  <hexa_data> is a data represented in hexadecimal format,\n"
04032     "      that is to be written to file.\n"
04033     "\n"
04034     "Examples:\n"
04035     "\n"
04036     "  For writing 10 times the null terminated string \"hello world\"\n"
04037     "  at the end of the file:\n"
04038     "        write -s END,0 -N 10 -A \"hello world\" filename\n"
04039     "\n"
04040     "  For overwriting the beginning of the file with\n"
04041     "  the pattern 0xA1267AEF31254ADE repeated twice:\n"
04042     "        write -s SET,0 -N 2 -X \"A1267AEF31254ADE\" filename\n";
04043   
04044   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
04045    
04046   /* is the fs initialized ? */
04047   if( !cache_init )
04048    {
04049      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
04050      return -1;
04051    }
04052 
04053   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
04054   
04055   /* analysing options */
04056   getopt_init();
04057 
04058   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
04059     {
04060       switch( option )
04061         {
04062         case 'v':
04063           if( flag_v )
04064             fprintf( output,
04065                      "write: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
04066           else 
04067             flag_v++;
04068           break;
04069           
04070         case 'h':
04071           if( flag_h )
04072             fprintf( output,
04073                      "write: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
04074           else 
04075             flag_h++;
04076           break;
04077           
04078         case 'N':
04079           if( flag_N )
04080             fprintf( output,
04081                      "write: warning: option 'N' has been specified more than once.\n");
04082           else
04083             {
04084               flag_N++;
04085               str_times = Optarg;
04086             }
04087           break;
04088           
04089         case 's':
04090           if( flag_s )
04091             fprintf( output,
04092                      "write: warning: option 's' has been specified more than once.\n");
04093           else
04094             {
04095               flag_s++;
04096               strncpy(str_seek_buff,Optarg,256);
04097               str_seek_type = str_seek_buff;
04098             }
04099           break;
04100           
04101         case 'A':
04102           if( flag_A )
04103             fprintf(output,
04104                     "write: warning: option 'A' has been specified more than once.\n");
04105           else if( flag_X )
04106             {
04107               fprintf(output,
04108                       "write: option 'A' conflicts with option 'X'.\n");
04109               err_flag ++;
04110             }
04111           else
04112             {
04113               flag_A++;
04114               str_ascii = Optarg;
04115             }
04116           break;
04117           
04118         case 'X':
04119           if( flag_X )
04120             fprintf(output,
04121                     "write: warning: option 'X' has been specified more than once.\n");
04122           else if( flag_A )
04123             {
04124               fprintf(output,
04125                       "write: option 'X' conflicts with option 'A'.\n");
04126               err_flag ++;
04127             }
04128           else
04129             {
04130               flag_X++;
04131               str_hexa = Optarg;
04132             }
04133           break;
04134           
04135         case '?':
04136           fprintf(output,"write: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
04137           err_flag ++;
04138           break;
04139         }    
04140     }
04141   
04142   if( flag_h )
04143     {
04144       /* print usage */
04145       fprintf( output, help_write );    
04146       return 0;
04147     }
04148   
04149   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
04150   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) ) 
04151     {
04152       err_flag ++;
04153     } 
04154   else 
04155     {
04156       file = argv[Optind];
04157     }
04158   
04159   if( err_flag )
04160     { 
04161       fprintf( output, help_write ) ;
04162       return -1;
04163     }
04164     
04165   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
04166   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
04167   
04168   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
04169   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
04170     return rc ; 
04171 
04172   /* Sanity check */
04173   if( obj_hdl->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
04174     {
04175       fprintf( output, "Error: This entry is no REGULAR_FILE\n" ) ;
04176       return 1 ;
04177     }
04178   
04179   /* Is this entry cached ? */
04180   if( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
04181     {
04182       if( flag_v ) 
04183         fprintf( output, "Warning: This entry is not data cached\n" ) ;
04184     }
04185   
04186     
04187   /* check argument types */
04188     
04189   if ( flag_N )
04190   {
04191     /* Try to convert the str_times to nb_times */
04192     
04193     rc = ato64( str_times, &nb_times );
04194     
04195     if ( rc == -1 )
04196     {
04197       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid number \"%s\"\n",
04198           str_times);
04199       return EINVAL;
04200     }
04201     
04202   }
04203   
04204   if ( flag_s )
04205   {
04206     int sign = 1;
04207 
04208     /* Try to parse the argument */
04209     
04210     str_seek_offset = strchr( str_seek_type, ',' );
04211     
04212     if ( str_seek_offset == NULL )
04213     {
04214       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid seek specifier \"%s\". <seek_type>,<offset> expected.\n",
04215           str_seek_type);
04216       return EINVAL;
04217     }
04218     
04219     *str_seek_offset='\0';
04220     str_seek_offset++; /* the first char after the "," */
04221 
04222     /* Check seek type */
04223 
04224     if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "CUR", 256 ) )
04225       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_CUR;
04226     else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "SET", 256 ) )
04227       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET;
04228     else if ( !strncmp( str_seek_type, "END", 256 ) )
04229       seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_END;
04230     else
04231     {
04232       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid seek type \"%s\". CUR, SET or END expected.\n",
04233           str_seek_type);
04234       return EINVAL;
04235     }
04236 
04237     /* Try to convert str_seek_offset to fsal_off_t */
04238 
04239     switch (str_seek_offset[0])
04240     {
04241       case '+':
04242         sign = 1;
04243         str_seek_offset ++;
04244         break;
04245 
04246       case '-':
04247         sign = -1;
04248         str_seek_offset ++;
04249         break;
04250     }
04251 
04252     rc = ato64( str_seek_offset, (unsigned long long *)&seek_desc.offset );
04253 
04254     if ( rc == -1 )
04255     {
04256       fprintf(output,"write: error: invalid offset \"%s\".\n",
04257           str_seek_offset);
04258       return EINVAL;
04259     }
04260     else
04261        if (sign < 0) seek_desc.offset = -seek_desc.offset;
04262 
04263     
04264   }
04265   /* else default seeking : SET,0 */
04266   
04267   if (flag_A)
04268   {
04269     datasize = strlen(str_ascii)+1; /* Include null termination char. */
04270     databuff = str_ascii;    
04271   }
04272   
04273   
04274   if (flag_X)
04275   {
04276     size_t length = strlen( str_hexa );
04277     
04278     datasize = (length >> 1);
04279     
04280     if ( length % 2 )
04281     {
04282     
04283       /* if it is not odd: error */
04284       fprintf(output,"write: error: in \"%s\", data length is not a multiple of 8 bits.\n",
04285             str_hexa);
04286     
04287       return EINVAL;
04288     }
04289     
04290     databuff = Mem_Alloc( datasize + 1 );
04291     
04292     if ( databuff == NULL )
04293     {
04294       fprintf(output,"write: error: Not enough memory to allocate %llu Bytes.\n",
04295             (unsigned long long)datasize);
04296       return ENOMEM;
04297     }
04298 
04299     
04300     memset( databuff, 0, datasize + 1 );
04301       
04302     /* try to convert the string to hexa */
04303     rc = sscanmem(databuff, datasize, str_hexa );
04304 
04305     if (rc != (int)(2*datasize) )
04306     {
04307       /* if it is not odd: error */
04308       fprintf(output,"write: error: \"%s\" in not a valid hexa format.\n",
04309             str_hexa);
04310 
04311       Mem_Free( str_hexa );
04312 
04313       return EINVAL;        
04314     }
04315     
04316   }
04317     
04318   
04319   if (flag_v)
04320   {    
04321     /* print a sum-up of write parameters */
04322     fprintf(output, "Write options: Data length: %llu x %llu Bytes, Seek: %s%+lld\n",
04323         (unsigned long long)nb_times,
04324         (unsigned long long)datasize,
04325         ( seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_SET ? "SET":
04326           seek_desc.whence==FSAL_SEEK_CUR ? "CUR":
04327           "END" ),
04328         (long long)seek_desc.offset);
04329   }
04330   
04331   /* variables initialisation */
04332     
04333   block_size = (fsal_size_t) datasize;  
04334   nb_block_written=0;
04335   size_written=0;  
04336   size_written_once=0;
04337   
04338   gettimeofday( &timer_start,NULL );  
04339   
04340   /* write loop */
04341     
04342   while ( nb_block_written < nb_times )
04343   {
04344     if( cache_inode_rdwr( obj_hdl, 
04345                           CACHE_INODE_WRITE,
04346                           &seek_desc,
04347                           block_size,
04348                           &size_written_once, 
04349                           &fsal_attr, 
04350                           (caddr_t)databuff,
04351                           &fsal_eof,
04352                           ht, 
04353                           &context->client, 
04354                           &context->context, 
04355                           &context->cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
04356     {
04357       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_write : %J%r\n",
04358                   ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
04359 
04360       return context->cache_status ;
04361     }
04362     
04363     fprintf( output,"." );
04364 
04365     /* update stats */
04366     
04367     if (size_written_once>0) nb_block_written ++;
04368     
04369     size_written += size_written_once;
04370     
04371     /* flush */
04372     if ( nb_block_written % 10 ) fflush( output );
04373 
04374     
04375     /* Update the seek descriptor */
04376     seek_desc.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
04377     seek_desc.offset += size_written_once ;
04378   }
04379   
04380   gettimeofday( &timer_stop,NULL );
04381   
04382   /* newline after written blocks */
04383   fprintf( output,"\n" );  
04384   
04385   if (flag_v)
04386   {
04387     double bandwidth ;
04388     
04389     /* print stats */
04390     fprintf(output, "Nb blocks written: %llu\n", nb_block_written);
04391     fprintf(output, "Total volume: %llu Bytes\n", size_written );
04392     
04393     fprintf(output, "Time enlapsed: ");
04394     timer_diff = time_diff( timer_start, timer_stop );
04395     print_timeval( output, timer_diff );
04396     
04397     bandwidth = size_written/(1024*1024*( timer_diff.tv_sec + 0.000001 * timer_diff.tv_usec ));
04398     
04399     fprintf(output, "Bandwidth: %f MB/s\n", bandwidth );
04400     
04401   }
04402   
04403   if (flag_X) Mem_Free( databuff );
04404   
04405   return 0;
04406 } /* fn_Cache_inode_write */
04407 
04408 
04409 
04411 int fn_Cache_inode_su( int argc , /* IN : number of args in argv */
04412                        char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
04413                        FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
04414 {
04415   
04416   char * str_uid;
04417   uid_t uid;
04418   fsal_status_t st;
04419   struct passwd * pw_struct;
04420   int i;
04421 
04422 # define MAX_GRPS  128
04423   gid_t   groups_tab[MAX_GRPS];
04424   int     nb_grp;
04425 
04426   static char help_su[]=
04427   "usage: su <uid>\n";
04428 
04429   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
04430    
04431   /* is the fs initialized ? */
04432   if( !cache_init )
04433    {
04434      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
04435      return -1;
04436    }
04437 
04438   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
04439   
04440   /* UID arg expected */
04441   if (argc!=2){
04442     fprintf(output,help_su);
04443     return -1;
04444   } else {
04445     str_uid = argv[1];
04446   }
04447   
04448   if ( isdigit( str_uid[0] ) )
04449   {
04450     if ( (uid = my_atoi(str_uid) ) == (uid_t)-1 )
04451     {
04452       fprintf(output,"Error: invalid uid \"%s\"\n",str_uid);
04453       return -1;
04454     }
04455     pw_struct = getpwuid(uid); 
04456   }
04457   else
04458   {
04459     pw_struct = getpwnam( str_uid );
04460   }
04461   
04462   if ( pw_struct == NULL )
04463   {
04464     fprintf( output, "Unknown user %s\n", str_uid );
04465     return errno;
04466   }
04467   
04468   nb_grp = getugroups( MAX_GRPS, groups_tab, pw_struct->pw_name, pw_struct->pw_gid );
04469   
04470   fprintf( output, "Changing user to : %s ( uid = %d, gid = %d )\n",
04471        pw_struct->pw_name , pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid );
04472   
04473   if ( nb_grp > 1 )
04474   {
04475     fprintf( output, "altgroups = ");
04476     for ( i = 1; i < nb_grp; i++ )
04477     {      
04478       if ( i == 1 )
04479         fprintf( output, "%d", groups_tab[i]);
04480       else
04481         fprintf( output, ", %d", groups_tab[i]);      
04482     }
04483     fprintf( output, "\n");
04484   }
04485 
04486   st = FSAL_GetClientContext( &context->context, &context->exp_context,
04487                               pw_struct->pw_uid, pw_struct->pw_gid, groups_tab, nb_grp );
04488       
04489   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(st) )
04490   {
04491     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_GetUserCred:");
04492     print_fsal_status(output,st);
04493     fprintf(output,"\n");
04494     return st.major;
04495   }
04496   
04497   fprintf(output,"Done.\n");
04498   
04499   return 0;
04500   
04501 }

04505 int fn_Cache_inode_open_by_name( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
04506         char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
04507         FILE * output )    /* IN : output stream          */
04508 {
04509   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];
04510   
04511   cache_entry_t *  pentry_file;
04512   fsal_attrib_list_t file_attr;
04513   fsal_status_t st;
04514   fsal_name_t filename ;
04515  
04516   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
04517   
04518   static char help_cd[]=
04519     "usage: open_by_name <path> \n";
04520     
04521   if( !cache_init )
04522     {
04523       fprintf( output, "\tCache is not initialized\n" ) ;
04524       return -1 ;
04525     }
04526   
04527   /* Exactly two arg expected */
04528   if (argc!=2){
04529     fprintf(output,help_cd);
04530     return -1;
04531   }
04532  
04533    /* Convert filename to fsal_name_t */
04534   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st = FSAL_str2name(argv[1],FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN,&filename))){
04535     fprintf(output,"Error executing FSAL_str2name:\n");
04536     print_fsal_status(output,st);
04537     fprintf(output,"\n");
04538     return st.major;
04539 
04540       return -1;
04541     }
04542  
04543   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
04544   
04545   strncpy(glob_path,context->current_path,FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
04546   
04547   if( ( pentry_file = cache_inode_lookup( context->pentry,
04548                                           &filename,
04549                                           &file_attr,
04550                                           ht,
04551                                           &context->client,
04552                                           &context->context,
04553                                           &context->cache_status ) ) == NULL )
04554     {
04555       fprintf(output,"Error: cannot lookup %s in %s : %u\n", argv[1], glob_path, context->cache_status);  
04556       return -1;
04557     }
04558    
04559   if( ( context->cache_status = cache_inode_open_by_name( context->pentry, 
04560                                                           &filename,
04561                                                           pentry_file,
04562                                                           &context->client, 
04563                                                           FSAL_O_RDWR, 
04564                                                           &context->context, 
04565                                                           &context->cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
04566     {
04567       log_fprintf( output, "Error executing cache_inode_open_by_name : %J%r\n",
04568                    ERR_CACHE_INODE, context->cache_status );
04569       return context->cache_status ;
04570     }    
04571     
04572     
04573   return 0;      
04574 }
04575 
04577 int fn_Cache_inode_close( int argc ,         /* IN : number of args in argv */
04578                           char ** argv ,     /* IN : arg list               */
04579                           FILE * output      /* IN : output stream          */ ) 
04580 {
04581   static char format[]="hv";
04582   
04583   static char help_flush_cache[]=
04584     "usage: flush_close [-h][-v]  <path>\n"
04585     "\n"
04586     "   -h : print this help\n"
04587     "   -v : verbose mode\n" ;
04588   
04589   
04590   char glob_path[FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN];  /* absolute path of the object */
04591   cache_entry_t *       obj_hdl;      /* handle of the object        */
04592   
04593   int rc,option;
04594   int flag_v=0;
04595   int flag_h=0;
04596   int err_flag=0;
04597   
04598   char * file = NULL;        /* the relative path to the object */  
04599       
04600   
04601   cmdCacheInode_thr_info_t * context;  
04602    
04603   /* is the fs initialized ? */
04604   if( !cache_init )
04605    {
04606      fprintf(output,"Error: Cache is not initialized\n");
04607      return -1;
04608    }
04609 
04610   context = RetrieveInitializedContext();
04611   
04612   /* analysing options */
04613   
04614   getopt_init();
04615   while( ( option = Getopt( argc, argv, format ) ) != -1 )
04616   {   
04617     switch( option )
04618       {
04619       case 'v':
04620         if( flag_v )
04621           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'v' has been specified more than once.\n");
04622         else 
04623           flag_v++;
04624         break;
04625         
04626       case 'h':
04627         if( flag_h )
04628           fprintf(output, "access: warning: option 'h' has been specified more than once.\n");
04629         else 
04630           flag_h++;
04631         break;
04632         
04633       default:
04634       case '?':
04635         fprintf(output,"access: unknown option : %c\n",Optopt);
04636         err_flag ++;
04637         break;
04638     }    
04639   }
04640   
04641   if( flag_h )
04642     {
04643       /* print usage */
04644       fprintf( output, help_flush_cache );    
04645       return 0;
04646     }
04647   
04648   /* Exactly 1 args expected */
04649   if( Optind != ( argc - 1 ) ) 
04650     {
04651       err_flag ++;
04652     } 
04653   else 
04654     {
04655       file = argv[Optind];
04656     }
04657   
04658   if( err_flag )
04659     { 
04660       fprintf( output, help_flush_cache );
04661       return -1;
04662     }
04663     
04664   /* copy current absolute path to a local variable. */
04665   strncpy( glob_path, context->current_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN);
04666   
04667   /* retrieve handle to the file whose permissions are to be tested */
04668   if( rc = cache_solvepath( glob_path, FSAL_MAX_PATH_LEN, file, context->pentry, &obj_hdl, output ) )
04669     return rc ; 
04670 
04671   if( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content == NULL )
04672     {
04673       fprintf( output, "Error: this entry is not data cached\n" ) ;
04674       return 1 ;
04675     }
04676 #ifdef _TOTO
04677   if( cache_content_flush( obj_hdl->object.file.pentry_content, 
04678                            CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE,
04679                            (cache_content_client_t *)context->client.pcontent_client, 
04680                            &context->context, 
04681                            &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
04682     {
04683       fprintf(output,"Error executing cache_content_flush: %d\n", cache_content_status );
04684       return cache_content_status ;
04685     }
04686 #endif
04687   fprintf( output, "not implemented yet\n" ) ;
04688   
04689   if( flag_v )
04690     {
04691       fprintf( output, "Entry %p has been flushed\n", obj_hdl ) ;
04692     }
04693 
04694   return 0 ;
04695 } /* fn_Cache_inode_close */
